Title:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 STIG SCAP Benchmark - NIWC Enhanced with Manual Questions
Description:This Security Technical Implementation Guide is published as a tool to improve the security of Department of Defense (DOD) information systems. The requirements are derived from the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800-53 and related documents. Comments or proposed revisions to this document should be sent via email to the following address: disa.stig_spt@mail.mil.
Notice:Portions of this document were developed at Naval Information Warfare Center Atlantic by employees of the Federal Government in the course of their official duties. Pursuant to title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code this software is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain. The Government assumes no responsibility whatsoever for its use by other parties, and the software is provided "AS IS" without warranty or guarantee of any kind, express or implied, including, but not limited to, the warranties of merchantability and of fitness for a particular purpose. In no event shall the Government be liable for any claim, damages or other liability, whether in an action of contract, tort or other dealings in the software. The Government has no obligation hereunder to provide maintenance, support, updates, enhancements, or modifications. We would appreciate acknowledgement if the software is used. This software can be redistributed and/or modified freely provided that any derivative works bear some notice that they are derived from it, and any modified versions bear some notice that they have been modified.
Front-Matter:This content stream was enhanced with OCIL manual questions derived from the STIG Manual by the NIWC SCC team.

Release Info:Enhanced Content 3.11.3 Date: 2023-05-09, based on Release: 3.11 Benchmark Date: 27 Apr 2023

Results: High Severity (CAT I)

    Automated Checks

    • V-204424 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow accounts configured with blank or null passwords. - Fail
    • V-204425 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not allow authentication using an empty password. - Pass
    • V-204432 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow an unattended or automatic logon to the system via a graphical user interface. - Pass
    • V-204433 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow an unrestricted logon to the system. - Pass
    • V-204438 - Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating systems version 7.2 or newer with a Basic Input/Output System (BIOS) must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes. - Fail
    • V-204440 - Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating systems version 7.2 or newer using Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes. - Pass
    • V-204442 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have the rsh-server package installed. - Pass
    • V-204443 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have the ypserv package installed. - Pass
    • V-204447 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent the installation of software, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components from a repository without verification they have been digitally signed using a certificate that is issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that is recognized and approved by the organization. - Pass
    • V-204448 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent the installation of software, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components of local packages without verification they have been digitally signed using a certificate that is issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that is recognized and approved by the organization. - Fail
    • V-204458 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be a vendor supported release. - Pass
    • V-204462 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the root account must be the only account having unrestricted access to the system. - Pass
    • V-204497 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement NIST FIPS-validated cryptography for the following: to provision digital signatures, to generate cryptographic hashes, and to protect data requiring data-at-rest protections in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards. - Fail
    • V-204502 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have the telnet-server package installed. - Pass
    • V-204594 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon is configured to only use the SSHv2 protocol. - Pass
    • V-204606 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not contain .shosts files. - Pass
    • V-204607 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not contain shosts.equiv files. - Pass
    • V-204620 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have a File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server package installed unless needed. - Pass
    • V-204621 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have the Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) server package installed if not required for operational support. - Pass
    • V-204627 - SNMP community strings on the Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be changed from the default. - Pass
    • V-214799 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the cryptographic hash of system files and commands matches vendor values. - Fail

    Manual Checks

    • V-204392 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the file permissions, ownership, and group membership of system files and commands match the vendor values. - Not Checked
    • V-204455 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the x86 Ctrl-Alt-Delete key sequence is disabled on the command line. - Not Checked
    • V-204456 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the x86 Ctrl-Alt-Delete key sequence is disabled in the Graphical User Interface. - Not Checked
    • V-214801 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use a virus scan program. - Not Checked
    • V-251702 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have accounts configured with blank or null passwords. - Not Checked

Results: Medium Severity (CAT II)

    Automated Checks

    • V-204393 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before granting local or remote access to the system via a graphical user logon. - Pass
    • V-204396 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must enable a user session lock until that user re-establishes access using established identification and authentication procedures. - Pass
    • V-204397 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must uniquely identify and must authenticate users using multifactor authentication via a graphical user logon. - Pass
    • V-204398 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must initiate a screensaver after a 15-minute period of inactivity for graphical user interfaces. - Pass
    • V-204399 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent a user from overriding the screensaver lock-delay setting for the graphical user interface. - Pass
    • V-204402 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must initiate a session lock for the screensaver after a period of inactivity for graphical user interfaces. - Pass
    • V-204403 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent a user from overriding the screensaver idle-activation-enabled setting for the graphical user interface. - Pass
    • V-204404 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must initiate a session lock for graphical user interfaces when the screensaver is activated. - Pass
    • V-204405 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that /etc/pam.d/passwd implements /etc/pam.d/system-auth when changing passwords. - Pass
    • V-204406 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that when passwords are changed or new passwords are established, pwquality must be used. - Pass
    • V-204407 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that when passwords are changed or new passwords are established, the new password must contain at least one upper-case character. - Fail
    • V-204408 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that when passwords are changed or new passwords are established, the new password must contain at least one lower-case character. - Fail
    • V-204409 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that when passwords are changed or new passwords are assigned, the new password must contain at least one numeric character. - Fail
    • V-204410 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that when passwords are changed or new passwords are established, the new password must contain at least one special character. - Fail
    • V-204411 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that when passwords are changed a minimum of eight of the total number of characters must be changed. - Fail
    • V-204412 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that when passwords are changed a minimum of four character classes must be changed. - Fail
    • V-204413 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that when passwords are changed the number of repeating consecutive characters must not be more than three characters. - Fail
    • V-204414 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that when passwords are changed the number of repeating characters of the same character class must not be more than four characters. - Fail
    • V-204415 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the PAM system service is configured to store only encrypted representations of passwords. - Pass
    • V-204416 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured to use the shadow file to store only encrypted representations of passwords. - Pass
    • V-204417 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that user and group account administration utilities are configured to store only encrypted representations of passwords. - Pass
    • V-204418 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that passwords for new users are restricted to a 24 hours/1 day minimum lifetime. - Fail
    • V-204419 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that passwords are restricted to a 24 hours/1 day minimum lifetime. - Fail
    • V-204420 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that passwords for new users are restricted to a 60-day maximum lifetime. - Fail
    • V-204421 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that existing passwords are restricted to a 60-day maximum lifetime. - Fail
    • V-204422 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that passwords are prohibited from reuse for a minimum of five generations. - Fail
    • V-204423 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that passwords are a minimum of 15 characters in length. - Fail
    • V-204426 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must disable account identifiers (individuals, groups, roles, and devices) if the password expires. - Fail
    • V-204429 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that users must provide a password for privilege escalation. - Fail
    • V-204430 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that users must re-authenticate for privilege escalation. - Pass
    • V-204431 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the delay between logon prompts following a failed console logon attempt is at least four seconds. - Fail
    • V-204434 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow users to override SSH environment variables. - Fail
    • V-204435 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow a non-certificate trusted host SSH logon to the system. - Fail
    • V-204437 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes. - Pass
    • V-204445 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that a file integrity tool verifies the baseline operating system configuration at least weekly. - Fail
    • V-204449 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured to disable USB mass storage. - Fail
    • V-204450 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the Datagram Congestion Control Protocol (DCCP) kernel module is disabled unless required. - Fail
    • V-204451 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must disable the file system automounter unless required. - Pass
    • V-204457 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must define default permissions for all authenticated users in such a way that the user can only read and modify their own files. - Pass
    • V-204466 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all local interactive user accounts, upon creation, are assigned a home directory. - Pass
    • V-204467 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all local interactive users have a home directory assigned and defined in the /etc/passwd file. - Pass
    • V-204482 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent files with the setuid and setgid bit set from being executed on file systems that are being imported via Network File System (NFS). - Pass
    • V-204483 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent binary files from being executed on file systems that are being imported via Network File System (NFS). - Pass
    • V-204487 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all world-writable directories are group-owned by root, sys, bin, or an application group. - Pass
    • V-204490 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the cron.allow file, if it exists, is owned by root. - Pass
    • V-204491 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the cron.allow file, if it exists, is group-owned by root. - Pass
    • V-204503 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that auditing is configured to produce records containing information to establish what type of events occurred, where the events occurred, the source of the events, and the outcome of the events. These audit records must also identify individual identities of group account users. - Pass
    • V-204504 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must shut down upon audit processing failure, unless availability is an overriding concern. If availability is a concern, the system must alert the designated staff (System Administrator [SA] and Information System Security Officer [ISSO] at a minimum) in the event of an audit processing failure. - Fail
    • V-204506 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured to off-load audit logs onto a different system or storage media from the system being audited. - Fail
    • V-204507 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must take appropriate action when the remote logging buffer is full. - Pass
    • V-204508 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must label all off-loaded audit logs before sending them to the central log server. - Pass
    • V-204509 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must off-load audit records onto a different system or media from the system being audited. - Fail
    • V-204510 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must encrypt the transfer of audit records off-loaded onto a different system or media from the system being audited. - Fail
    • V-204511 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the audit system takes appropriate action when the audit storage volume is full. - Fail
    • V-204512 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the audit system takes appropriate action when there is an error sending audit records to a remote system. - Fail
    • V-204514 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must immediately notify the System Administrator (SA) and Information System Security Officer (ISSO) (at a minimum) via email when the threshold for the repository maximum audit record storage capacity is reached. - Fail
    • V-204515 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must immediately notify the System Administrator (SA) and Information System Security Officer (ISSO) (at a minimum) when the threshold for the repository maximum audit record storage capacity is reached. - Pass
    • V-204516 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all executions of privileged functions. - Fail
    • V-204517 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chown, fchown, fchownat, and lchown syscalls. - Fail
    • V-204521 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chmod, fchmod, and fchmodat syscalls. - Fail
    • V-204524 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the setxattr, fsetxattr, lsetxattr, removexattr, fremovexattr, and lremovexattr syscalls. - Fail
    • V-204531 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the creat, open, openat, open_by_handle_at, truncate, and ftruncate syscalls. - Fail
    • V-204536 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the semanage command. - Fail
    • V-204537 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the setsebool command. - Fail
    • V-204538 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chcon command. - Fail
    • V-204539 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the setfiles command. - Fail
    • V-204540 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all unsuccessful account access events. - Fail
    • V-204541 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all successful account access events. - Fail
    • V-204542 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the passwd command. - Fail
    • V-204543 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the unix_chkpwd command. - Fail
    • V-204544 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the gpasswd command. - Fail
    • V-204545 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chage command. - Fail
    • V-204546 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the userhelper command. - Fail
    • V-204547 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the su command. - Fail
    • V-204548 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the sudo command. - Fail
    • V-204549 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the sudoers file and all files in the /etc/sudoers.d/ directory. - Fail
    • V-204550 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the newgrp command. - Fail
    • V-204551 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chsh command. - Fail
    • V-204552 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the mount command and syscall. - Fail
    • V-204553 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the umount command. - Fail
    • V-204554 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the postdrop command. - Fail
    • V-204555 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the postqueue command. - Fail
    • V-204556 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the ssh-keysign command. - Fail
    • V-204557 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the crontab command. - Fail
    • V-204558 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the pam_timestamp_check command. - Fail
    • V-204559 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the create_module syscall. - Fail
    • V-204560 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the init_module and finit_module syscalls. - Fail
    • V-204562 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the delete_module syscall. - Fail
    • V-204563 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the kmod command. - Fail
    • V-204564 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/passwd. - Fail
    • V-204565 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/group. - Fail
    • V-204566 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/gshadow. - Fail
    • V-204567 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/shadow. - Fail
    • V-204568 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/security/opasswd. - Fail
    • V-204572 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the unlink, unlinkat, rename, renameat, and rmdir syscalls. - Fail
    • V-204578 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 operating system must implement DoD-approved encryption to protect the confidentiality of SSH connections. - Fail
    • V-204579 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all network connections associated with a communication session are terminated at the end of the session or after 15 minutes of inactivity from the user at a command prompt, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements. - Fail
    • V-204584 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement virtual address space randomization. - Fail
    • V-204585 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all networked systems have SSH installed. - Pass
    • V-204587 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all network connections associated with SSH traffic are terminated at the end of the session or after 10 minutes of inactivity, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements. - Fail
    • V-204588 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not allow authentication using RSA rhosts authentication. - Pass
    • V-204589 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all network connections associated with SSH traffic terminate after a period of inactivity. - Fail
    • V-204590 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not allow authentication using rhosts authentication. - Fail
    • V-204591 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon an SSH logon. - Fail
    • V-204592 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not permit direct logons to the root account using remote access via SSH. - Fail
    • V-204593 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not allow authentication using known hosts authentication. - Fail
    • V-204595 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon is configured to only use Message Authentication Codes (MACs) employing FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hash algorithms. - Fail
    • V-204596 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH public host key files have mode 0644 or less permissive. - Pass
    • V-204597 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH private host key files have mode 0640 or less permissive. - Pass
    • V-204598 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not permit Generic Security Service Application Program Interface (GSSAPI) authentication unless needed. - Fail
    • V-204599 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not permit Kerberos authentication unless needed. - Fail
    • V-204600 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon performs strict mode checking of home directory configuration files. - Fail
    • V-204601 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon uses privilege separation. - Fail
    • V-204602 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not allow compression or only allows compression after successful authentication. - Pass
    • V-204609 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not forward Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) source-routed packets. - Pass
    • V-204612 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not forward Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) source-routed packets by default. - Pass
    • V-204613 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not respond to Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) echoes sent to a broadcast address. - Fail
    • V-204614 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages from being accepted. - Fail
    • V-204615 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must ignore Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages. - Fail
    • V-204616 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow interfaces to perform Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects by default. - Fail
    • V-204617 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not send Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects. - Fail
    • V-204622 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that remote X connections are disabled except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements. - Fail
    • V-204624 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have a graphical display manager installed unless approved. - Pass
    • V-204625 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not be performing packet forwarding unless the system is a router. - Fail
    • V-204630 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not forward IPv6 source-routed packets. - Pass
    • V-204631 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must have the required packages for multifactor authentication installed. - Fail
    • V-204632 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement multifactor authentication for access to privileged accounts via pluggable authentication modules (PAM). - Fail
    • V-204633 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement certificate status checking for PKI authentication. - Fail
    • V-237633 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must restrict privilege elevation to authorized personnel. - Pass
    • V-237634 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use the invoking user's password for privilege escalation when using "sudo". - Fail
    • V-237635 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must require re-authentication when using the "sudo" command. - Fail

    Manual Checks

    • V-204394 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the approved Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before granting local or remote access to the system via a graphical user logon. - Not Checked
    • V-204395 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before granting local or remote access to the system via a command line user logon. - Not Checked
    • V-204400 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent a user from overriding the session idle-delay setting for the graphical user interface. - Not Checked
    • V-204427 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured to lock accounts for a minimum of 15 minutes after three unsuccessful logon attempts within a 15-minute timeframe. - Not Checked
    • V-204428 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must lock the associated account after three unsuccessful root logon attempts are made within a 15-minute period. - Not Checked
    • V-204441 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must uniquely identify and must authenticate organizational users (or processes acting on behalf of organizational users) using multifactor authentication. - Not Checked
    • V-204444 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions to include disabling, circumventing, or altering implemented security safeguards/countermeasures. - Not Checked
    • V-204446 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that designated personnel are notified if baseline configurations are changed in an unauthorized manner. - Not Checked
    • V-204453 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must enable SELinux. - Not Checked
    • V-204454 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must enable the SELinux targeted policy. - Not Checked
    • V-204459 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system security patches and updates must be installed and up to date. - Not Checked
    • V-204460 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have unnecessary accounts. - Not Checked
    • V-204463 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all files and directories have a valid owner. - Not Checked
    • V-204464 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all files and directories have a valid group owner. - Not Checked
    • V-204468 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all local interactive user home directories have mode 0750 or less permissive. - Not Checked
    • V-204469 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all local interactive user home directories are owned by their respective users. - Not Checked
    • V-204470 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all local interactive user home directories are group-owned by the home directory owners primary group. - Not Checked
    • V-204471 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all files and directories contained in local interactive user home directories have a valid owner. - Not Checked
    • V-204472 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all files and directories contained in local interactive user home directories are group-owned by a group of which the home directory owner is a member. - Not Checked
    • V-204473 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all files and directories contained in local interactive user home directories have a mode of 0750 or less permissive. - Not Checked
    • V-204474 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all local initialization files for interactive users are owned by the home directory user or root. - Not Checked
    • V-204475 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all local initialization files for local interactive users are be group-owned by the users primary group or root. - Not Checked
    • V-204476 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all local initialization files have mode 0740 or less permissive. - Not Checked
    • V-204477 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all local interactive user initialization files executable search paths contain only paths that resolve to the users home directory. - Not Checked
    • V-204478 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that local initialization files do not execute world-writable programs. - Not Checked
    • V-204479 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all system device files are correctly labeled to prevent unauthorized modification. - Not Checked
    • V-204480 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that file systems containing user home directories are mounted to prevent files with the setuid and setgid bit set from being executed. - Not Checked
    • V-204481 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent files with the setuid and setgid bit set from being executed on file systems that are used with removable media. - Not Checked
    • V-204488 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must set the umask value to 077 for all local interactive user accounts. - Not Checked
    • V-204489 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must have cron logging implemented. - Not Checked
    • V-204492 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must disable Kernel core dumps unless needed. - Not Checked
    • V-204500 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use a file integrity tool that is configured to use FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashes for validating file contents and directories. - Not Checked
    • V-204501 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow removable media to be used as the boot loader unless approved. - Not Checked
    • V-204513 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must initiate an action to notify the System Administrator (SA) and Information System Security Officer ISSO, at a minimum, when allocated audit record storage volume reaches 75% of the repository maximum audit record storage capacity. - Not Checked
    • V-204574 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must send rsyslog output to a log aggregation server. - Not Checked
    • V-204575 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the rsyslog daemon does not accept log messages from other servers unless the server is being used for log aggregation. - Not Checked
    • V-204577 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured to prohibit or restrict the use of functions, ports, protocols, and/or services, as defined in the Ports, Protocols, and Services Management Component Local Service Assessment (PPSM CLSA) and vulnerability assessments. - Not Checked
    • V-204580 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner immediately prior to, or as part of, remote access logon prompts. - Not Checked
    • V-204581 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement cryptography to protect the integrity of Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) authentication communications. - Not Checked
    • V-204582 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement cryptography to protect the integrity of Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) communications. - Not Checked
    • V-204583 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement cryptography to protect the integrity of Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) communications. - Not Checked
    • V-204586 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all networked systems use SSH for confidentiality and integrity of transmitted and received information as well as information during preparation for transmission. - Not Checked
    • V-204603 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must, for networked systems, synchronize clocks with a server that is synchronized to one of the redundant United States Naval Observatory (USNO) time servers, a time server designated for the appropriate DoD network (NIPRNet/SIPRNet), and/or the Global Positioning System (GPS). - Not Checked
    • V-204604 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must enable an application firewall, if available. - Not Checked
    • V-204610 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use a reverse-path filter for IPv4 network traffic when possible on all interfaces. - Not Checked
    • V-204611 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use a reverse-path filter for IPv4 network traffic when possible by default. - Not Checked
    • V-204618 - Network interfaces configured on the Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not be in promiscuous mode. - Not Checked
    • V-204619 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured to prevent unrestricted mail relaying. - Not Checked
    • V-204623 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that if the Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) server is required, the TFTP daemon is configured to operate in secure mode. - Not Checked
    • V-204626 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the Network File System (NFS) is configured to use RPCSEC_GSS. - Not Checked
    • V-204628 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system access control program must be configured to grant or deny system access to specific hosts and services. - Not Checked
    • V-204629 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have unauthorized IP tunnels configured. - Not Checked
    • V-204634 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all wireless network adapters are disabled. - Not Checked
    • V-214800 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement the Endpoint Security for Linux Threat Prevention tool. - Not Checked
    • V-214937 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent a user from overriding the screensaver lock-enabled setting for the graphical user interface. - Not Checked
    • V-219059 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must disable the graphical user interface automounter unless required. - Not Checked
    • V-228563 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all world-writable directories are owned by root, sys, bin, or an application user. - Not Checked
    • V-228564 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must protect audit information from unauthorized read, modification, or deletion. - Not Checked
    • V-233307 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system SSH daemon must prevent remote hosts from connecting to the proxy display. - Not Checked
    • V-244557 - Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating systems version 7.2 or newer booted with a BIOS must have a unique name for the grub superusers account when booting into single-user and maintenance modes. - Not Checked
    • V-244558 - Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating systems version 7.2 or newer booted with United Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) must have a unique name for the grub superusers account when booting into single-user mode and maintenance. - Not Checked
    • V-250312 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must confine SELinux users to roles that conform to least privilege. - Not Checked
    • V-250313 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow privileged accounts to utilize SSH. - Not Checked
    • V-250314 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must elevate the SELinux context when an administrator calls the sudo command. - Not Checked
    • V-251703 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must specify the default "include" directory for the /etc/sudoers file. - Not Checked
    • V-251704 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not be configured to bypass password requirements for privilege escalation. - Not Checked
    • V-251705 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use a file integrity tool to verify correct operation of all security functions. - Not Checked
    • V-254523 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must automatically expire temporary accounts within 72 hours. - Not Checked
    • V-255925 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system SSH server must be configured to use only FIPS-validated key exchange algorithms. - Not Checked
    • V-255926 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must have the screen package installed. - Not Checked
    • V-255928 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured to prevent overwriting of custom authentication configuration settings by the authconfig utility. - Not Checked
    • V-256968 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must ensure cryptographic verification of vendor software packages. - Not Checked
    • V-256969 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must disable the login screen user list for graphical user interfaces. - Not Checked
    • V-256970 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured to allow sending email notifications of configuration changes and adverse events to designated personnel. - Not Checked

Results: Low Severity (CAT III)

    Automated Checks

    • V-204452 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must remove all software components after updated versions have been installed. - Fail
    • V-204461 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all Group Identifiers (GIDs) referenced in the /etc/passwd file are defined in the /etc/group file. - Pass
    • V-204493 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that a separate file system is used for user home directories (such as /home or an equivalent). - Fail
    • V-204494 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use a separate file system for /var. - Fail
    • V-204495 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use a separate file system for the system audit data path. - Fail
    • V-204496 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use a separate file system for /tmp (or equivalent). - Fail
    • V-204576 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must limit the number of concurrent sessions to 10 for all accounts and/or account types. - Fail
    • V-204605 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon logon. - Fail

    Manual Checks

    • V-204486 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must mount /dev/shm with secure options. - Not Checked
    • V-204498 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the file integrity tool is configured to verify Access Control Lists (ACLs). - Not Checked
    • V-204499 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the file integrity tool is configured to verify extended attributes. - Not Checked
    • V-204608 - For Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating systems using DNS resolution, at least two name servers must be configured. - Not Checked
    • V-255927 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must restrict access to the kernel message buffer. - Not Checked

Detailed Results: High Severity (CAT I)

    V-204424 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow accounts configured with blank or null passwords.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204424r880839_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:RHEL-07-010290
    Identities:V-71937
    SV-86561
    CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: If an account has an empty password, anyone could log on and run commands with the privileges of that account. Accounts with empty passwords should never be used in operational environments. false
    Fix Text:If an account is configured for password authentication but does not have an assigned password, it may be possible to log on to the account without authenticating.

    Remove any instances of the "nullok" option in "/etc/pam.d/system-auth" and "/etc/pam.d/password-auth" to prevent logons with empty passwords.

    Note: Per requirement RHEL-07-010199, RHEL 7 must be configured to not overwrite custom authentication configuration settings while using the authconfig utility, otherwise manual changes to the listed files will be overwritten whenever the authconfig utility is used.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1229
    Result:false
    Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow accounts configured with blank or null passwords.
    Description:The file /etc/pam.d/system-auth should not contain the nullok option
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (make sure nullok is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth)
      • false (make sure nullok is not used in /etc/pam.d/password-auth)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1230 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:make sure nullok is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2964 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^[^#]*\s*nullok\s*'
    • instance must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ not evaluated ]
    • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
    • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
    • filename equals 'system-auth'
    • pattern equals '^[^#]*\s*nullok\s*'
    • instance equals '1'
    • text equals 'auth required pam_env.so
      auth required pam_faildelay.so delay=2000000
      auth sufficient pam_unix.so nullok try_first_pass
      auth requisite pam_succeed_if.so uid >= 1000 quiet_success
      auth required pam_deny.so

      account required pam_unix.so
      account sufficient pam_localuser.so
      account sufficient pam_succeed_if.so uid < 1000 quiet
      account required pam_permit.so

      password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type=
      password sufficient pam_unix.so sha512 shadow nullok '
    • line equals 'auth required pam_env.so
      auth required pam_faildelay.so delay=2000000
      auth sufficient pam_unix.so nullok try_first_pass
      auth requisite pam_succeed_if.so uid >= 1000 quiet_success
      auth required pam_deny.so

      account required pam_unix.so
      account sufficient pam_localuser.so
      account sufficient pam_succeed_if.so uid < 1000 quiet
      account required pam_permit.so

      password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type=
      password sufficient pam_unix.so sha512 shadow nullok '
    • subexpression does not exist
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:123000 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:make sure nullok is not used in /etc/pam.d/password-auth
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:296400 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam.d/password-auth'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^[^#]*\s*nullok\s*'
    • instance must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ not evaluated ]
    • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/password-auth'
    • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
    • filename equals 'password-auth'
    • pattern equals '^[^#]*\s*nullok\s*'
    • instance equals '1'
    • text equals 'auth required pam_env.so
      auth required pam_faildelay.so delay=2000000
      auth sufficient pam_unix.so nullok try_first_pass
      auth requisite pam_succeed_if.so uid >= 1000 quiet_success
      auth required pam_deny.so

      account required pam_unix.so
      account sufficient pam_localuser.so
      account sufficient pam_succeed_if.so uid < 1000 quiet
      account required pam_permit.so

      password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type=
      password sufficient pam_unix.so sha512 shadow nullok '
    • line equals 'auth required pam_env.so
      auth required pam_faildelay.so delay=2000000
      auth sufficient pam_unix.so nullok try_first_pass
      auth requisite pam_succeed_if.so uid >= 1000 quiet_success
      auth required pam_deny.so

      account required pam_unix.so
      account sufficient pam_localuser.so
      account sufficient pam_succeed_if.so uid < 1000 quiet
      account required pam_permit.so

      password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type=
      password sufficient pam_unix.so sha512 shadow nullok '
    • subexpression does not exist
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-204425 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not allow authentication using an empty password.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204425r603261_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-010300
    Identities:SV-86563
    V-71939
    CCI-000766 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-2 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-2 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (2))
    Description: Configuring this setting for the SSH daemon provides additional assurance that remote logon via SSH will require a password, even in the event of misconfiguration elsewhere. false
    Fix Text:To explicitly disallow remote logon from accounts with empty passwords, add or correct the following line in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config":

    PermitEmptyPasswords no

    The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect. Any accounts with empty passwords should be disabled immediately, and PAM configuration should prevent users from being able to assign themselves empty passwords.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1375
    Result:true
    Title:Disable Empty Passwords
    Description:Remote connections from accounts with empty passwords should
    be disabled (and dependencies are met)
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • true (/etc/ssh/sshd_config PermitEmptyPasswords)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (package openssh-server is removed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1376 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:/etc/ssh/sshd_config PermitEmptyPasswords
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3061 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • behavior requirements:
      • ignore_case = true
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*PermitEmptyPasswords[ \t]+([^\s#]*)[ \t]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:137500 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^(no|"no")$'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:false
    Title:package openssh-server is removed
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ not evaluated ]
    • name equals 'openssh-server'
    • arch equals 'x86_64'
    • epoch equals '(none)'
    • release equals '21.el7'
    • version equals '7.4p1'
    • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
    • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
    • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-204432 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow an unattended or automatic logon to the system via a graphical user interface.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204432r877377_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-010440
    Identities:V-71953
    SV-86577
    CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Failure to restrict system access to authenticated users negatively impacts operating system security. false
    Fix Text:Configure the operating system to not allow an unattended or automatic logon to the system via a graphical user interface.

    Note: If the system does not have GNOME installed, this requirement is Not Applicable.

    Add or edit the line for the "AutomaticLoginEnable" parameter in the [daemon] section of the "/etc/gdm/custom.conf" file to "false":

    [daemon]
    AutomaticLoginEnable=false
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1119
    Result:true
    Title:Disable GDM Automatic Login
    Description:Disable the GNOME Display Manager (GDM) ability to allow users to
    automatically login.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (AutomaticLoginEnable present in daemon section)
        • false (All AutomaticLoginEnable lines are set correctly)
      • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
        • false (package gdm is installed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1121 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:AutomaticLoginEnable present in daemon section
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2881 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/gdm/custom.conf'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\[daemon]\n(?!([^\n]*\n+)*\[[^\n\]]*]([^\n]*\n+)*AutomaticLoginEnable[ ]?=[ ]?)([^\n]*\n+)*AutomaticLoginEnable[ ]?=[ ]?'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:111900 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:All AutomaticLoginEnable lines are set correctly
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:111900 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/gdm/custom.conf'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^[ ]*AutomaticLoginEnable[ ]?=[ ]?([^\W]*)[ ]*$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:111900 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^[Ff][Aa][Ll][Ss][Ee]$'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1258 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:false
    Title:package gdm is installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2987 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'gdm'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-204433 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow an unrestricted logon to the system.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204433r877377_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-010450
    Identities:V-71955
    SV-86579
    CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Failure to restrict system access to authenticated users negatively impacts operating system security. false
    Fix Text:Configure the operating system to not allow an unrestricted account to log on to the system via a graphical user interface.

    Note: If the system does not have GNOME installed, this requirement is Not Applicable.

    Add or edit the line for the "TimedLoginEnable" parameter in the [daemon] section of the "/etc/gdm/custom.conf" file to "false":

    [daemon]
    TimedLoginEnable=false
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1122
    Result:true
    Title:Disable GDM Guest Login
    Description:Disable the GNOME Display Manager (GDM) ability to allow guest users
    to login.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (TimedLoginEnable present in daemon section)
        • false (All TimedLoginEnable lines are set correctly)
      • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
        • false (package gdm is installed)
    Tests:

    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.

    Object Requirements:

    • pattern must match the pattern '^\[daemon]\n(?!([^\n]*\n+)*\[[^\n\]]*]([^\n]*\n+)*TimedLoginEnable[ ]?=[ ]?)([^\n]*\n+)*TimedLoginEnable[ ]?=[ ]?'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:112200 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:All TimedLoginEnable lines are set correctly
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:112200 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/gdm/custom.conf'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^[ ]*TimedLoginEnable[ ]?=[ ]?([^\W]*)[ ]*$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

    State Requirements:

    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1258 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:false

    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2987 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'gdm'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-204438 - Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating systems version 7.2 or newer with a Basic Input/Output System (BIOS) must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204438r744095_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:RHEL-07-010482
    Identities:SV-95717
    V-81005
    CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3)
    Description: If the system does not require valid authentication before it boots into single-user or maintenance mode, anyone who invokes single-user or maintenance mode is granted privileged access to all files on the system. GRUB 2 is the default boot loader for RHEL 7 and is designed to require a password to boot into single-user mode or make modifications to the boot menu. false
    Fix Text:Configure the system to encrypt the boot password for the grub superusers account with the grub2-setpassword command, which creates/overwrites the /boot/grub2/user.cfg file.

    Generate an encrypted grub2 password for the grub superusers account with the following command:

    $ sudo grub2-setpassword
    Enter password:
    Confirm password:
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:95717
    Result:false
    Title:Set Boot Loader Password (BIOS) for RHEL 7.2 and up
    Description:The grub2 boot loader should have password protection enabled.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (make sure a password is defined in /boot/grub2/user.cfg)
        • true (superuser is defined in /boot/grub2/grub.cfg files.)
      • false (Running RHEL 7.0 or 7.1?)
      • false (/boot/grub2/grub.cfg does not exist)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9571700 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:make sure a password is defined in /boot/grub2/user.cfg
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9571700 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/boot/grub2/user.cfg'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*GRUB2_PASSWORD=grub\.pbkdf2\.sha512\.\S+$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9571701 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:superuser is defined in /boot/grub2/grub.cfg files.
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9571701 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/boot/grub2/grub.cfg'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*set[\s]+superusers=\"\S+\"\s*$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ not evaluated ]
    • filepath equals '/boot/grub2/grub.cfg'
    • path equals '/boot/grub2'
    • filename equals 'grub.cfg'
    • pattern equals '^[\s]*set[\s]+superusers=\"\S+\"\s*$'
    • instance equals '1'
    • text equals ' set superusers="root"'
    • line equals ' set superusers="root"'
    • subexpression does not exist
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8658500 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Running RHEL 7.0 or 7.1?
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:16900 (textfilecontent54_object)

    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/redhat-release'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^Red Hat Enterprise Linux.*release\s+(\S+)\s+'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

    • path equals '/etc'
    • filename equals 'redhat-release'
    • pattern equals '^Red Hat Enterprise Linux.*release\s+(\S+)\s+'

    • line equals 'Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.9 '

    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    subexpression
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:909 (file_test)

    V-204440 - Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating systems version 7.2 or newer using Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204440r744098_rule

    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-010491
    Identities:SV-95719
    V-81007
    CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3)
    Description: If the system does not require valid authentication before it boots into single-user or maintenance mode, anyone who invokes single-user or maintenance mode is granted privileged access to all files on the system. GRUB 2 is the default boot loader for RHEL 7 and is designed to require a password to boot into single-user mode or make modifications to the boot menu. false

    V-204442 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have the rsh-server package installed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204442r603261_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-020000
    Identities:V-71967
    SV-86591
    CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

    Operating systems are capable of providing a wide variety of functions and services. Some of the functions and services, provided by default, may not be necessary to support essential organizational operations (e.g., key missions, functions).

    The rsh-server service provides an unencrypted remote access service that does not provide for the confidentiality and integrity of user passwords or the remote session and has very weak authentication.

    If a privileged user were to log on using this service, the privileged user password could be compromised. false
    Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable non-essential capabilities by removing the rsh-server package from the system with the following command:

    # yum remove rsh-server
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1271
    Result:true
    Title:Package rsh-server Removed
    Description:The RPM package rsh-server should be removed.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (package rsh-server is removed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1272 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:true
    Title:package rsh-server is removed
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2996 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'rsh-server'

    V-204447 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent the installation of software, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components from a repository without verification they have been digitally signed using a certificate that is issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that is recognized and approved by the organization.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204447r877463_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-020050
    Identities:V-71977
    SV-86601
    CCI-001749 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (3))
    Description: Changes to any software components can have significant effects on the overall security of the operating system. This requirement ensures the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor.

    Accordingly, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components must be signed with a certificate recognized and approved by the organization.

    Verifying the authenticity of the software prior to installation validates the integrity of the patch or upgrade received from a vendor. This verifies the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor. Self-signed certificates are disallowed by this requirement. The operating system should not have to verify the software again. This requirement does not mandate DoD certificates for this purpose; however, the certificate used to verify the software must be from an approved CA. false
    Fix Text:Configure the operating system to verify the signature of packages from a repository prior to install by setting the following option in the "/etc/yum.conf" file:

    gpgcheck=1
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1027
    Result:true
    Title:Ensure Yum gpgcheck Globally Activated
    Description:The gpgcheck option should be used to ensure that checking
    of an RPM package's signature always occurs prior to its
    installation.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • true (check value of gpgcheck in /etc/yum.conf)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1029 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:check value of gpgcheck in /etc/yum.conf
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2796 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/yum.conf'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*gpgcheck\s*=\s*(\S+)\s*$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:102700 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • filepath equals '/etc/yum.conf'
    • path equals '/etc'
    • filename equals 'yum.conf'
    • pattern equals '^\s*gpgcheck\s*=\s*(\S+)\s*$'
    • instance equals '1'
    • text equals 'gpgcheck=1'
    • line equals 'gpgcheck=1'
    • subexpression equals '1'

    V-204448 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent the installation of software, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components of local packages without verification they have been digitally signed using a certificate that is issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that is recognized and approved by the organization.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204448r877463_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:RHEL-07-020060
    Identities:V-71979
    SV-86603
    CCI-001749 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (3))
    Description: Changes to any software components can have significant effects on the overall security of the operating system. This requirement ensures the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor.

    Accordingly, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components must be signed with a certificate recognized and approved by the organization.

    Verifying the authenticity of the software prior to installation validates the integrity of the patch or upgrade received from a vendor. This verifies the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor. Self-signed certificates are disallowed by this requirement. The operating system should not have to verify the software again. This requirement does not mandate DoD certificates for this purpose; however, the certificate used to verify the software must be from an approved CA. false
    Fix Text:Configure the operating system to verify the signature of local packages prior to install by setting the following option in the "/etc/yum.conf" file:

    localpkg_gpgcheck=1
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899

    Result:false
    Title:Ensure gpgcheck Enabled for Local Packages
    Description:The localpkg_gpgcheck option should be used to ensure that checking
    of an RPM package's signature always occurs prior to its
    installation.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (check value of localpkg_gpgcheck in /etc/yum.conf)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:111 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:check value of localpkg_gpgcheck in /etc/yum.conf
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2062 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/yum.conf'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*localpkg_gpgcheck\s*=\s*(\S+)\s*$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:11100 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^(1|True|yes)$'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-204458 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be a vendor supported release.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204458r744100_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-020250
    Identities:SV-86621
    V-71997
    CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: An operating system release is considered "supported" if the vendor continues to provide security patches for the product. With an unsupported release, it will not be possible to resolve security issues discovered in the system software.

    Red Hat offers the Extended Update Support (EUS) Add-On to a Red Hat Enterprise Linux subscription, for a fee, for those customers who wish to standardize on a specific minor release for an extended period. RHEL 7.7 marks the final minor release that EUS will be available, while 7.9 is the final minor release overall. false
    Fix Text:Upgrade to a supported version of the operating system.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:169
    Result:true
    Title:RHEL-07-020250 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be a vendor supported release
    Description:An operating system release is considered "supported" if the vendor continues to provide security patches for the product. With an unsupported release, it will not be possible to resolve security issues discovered in the system software.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (Supported RHEL7 minor version)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (redhat-release-virtualization-host RPM package is installed)
          • false (RHEVH base RHEL is version 7)
        • false (redhat-release-client is version 7)
        • false (redhat-release-workstation is version 7)
        • true (redhat-release-server is version 7)
        • false (redhat-release-computenode is version 7)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:16900 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Supported RHEL7 minor version
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:16900 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/redhat-release'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^Red Hat Enterprise Linux.*release\s+(\S+)\s+'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:16907 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '7.9'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • filepath equals '/etc/redhat-release'
    • path equals '/etc'
    • filename equals 'redhat-release'
    • pattern equals '^Red Hat Enterprise Linux.*release\s+(\S+)\s+'
    • instance equals '1'
    • text equals 'Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.9 '
    • line equals 'Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.9 '
    • subexpression equals '7.9'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:21 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:false
    Title:redhat-release-virtualization-host RPM package is installed
    Check Existence:One and only one collected item may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:60 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'redhat-release-virtualization-host'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:22 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:RHEVH base RHEL is version 7
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:61 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
