    V-204462 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the root account must be the only account having unrestricted access to the system.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204462r603261_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-020310
    Identities:SV-86629
    V-72005
    CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: If an account other than root also has a User Identifier (UID) of "0", it has root authority, giving that account unrestricted access to the entire operating system. Multiple accounts with a UID of "0" afford an opportunity for potential intruders to guess a password for a privileged account. false
    Fix Text:Change the UID of any account on the system, other than root, that has a UID of "0".

    If the account is associated with system commands or applications, the UID should be changed to one greater than "0" but less than "1000". Otherwise, assign a UID of greater than "1000" that has not already been assigned.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:457
    Result:true
    Title:UID 0 Belongs Only To Root
    Description:Only the root account should be assigned a user id of 0.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (test that there are no accounts with UID 0 except root in the /etc/passwd file)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:458 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:test that there are no accounts with UID 0 except root in the /etc/passwd file
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2347 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/passwd'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^(?!root:)[^:]*:[^:]*:0'
    • instance must be equal to '1'

    V-204497 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement NIST FIPS-validated cryptography for the following: to provision digital signatures, to generate cryptographic hashes, and to protect data requiring data-at-rest protections in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204497r877398_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:RHEL-07-021350
    Identities:SV-86691
    V-72067
    CCI-000068 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-17 (2))
    CCI-001199 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-28; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-28.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-28; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-28)
    CCI-002450 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-13; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-13 b)
    CCI-002476 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-28 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-28 (1))
    Description: Use of weak or untested encryption algorithms undermines the purposes of using encryption to protect data. The operating system must implement cryptographic modules adhering to the higher standards approved by the federal government since this provides assurance they have been tested and validated.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000033-GPOS-00014, SRG-OS-000185-GPOS-00079, SRG-OS-000396-GPOS-00176, SRG-OS-000405-GPOS-00184, SRG-OS-000478-GPOS-00223 false
    Fix Text:Configure the operating system to implement DoD-approved encryption by installing the dracut-fips package.

    To enable strict FIPS compliance, the fips=1 kernel option needs to be added to the kernel command line during system installation so key generation is done with FIPS-approved algorithms and continuous monitoring tests in place.

    Configure the operating system to implement DoD-approved encryption by following the steps below:

    The fips=1 kernel option needs to be added to the kernel command line during system installation so that key generation is done with FIPS-approved algorithms and continuous monitoring tests in place. Users should also ensure that the system has plenty of entropy during the installation process by moving the mouse around, or if no mouse is available, ensuring that many keystrokes are typed. The recommended amount of keystrokes is 256 and more. Less than 256 keystrokes may generate a non-unique key.

    Install the dracut-fips package with the following command:

    # yum install dracut-fips

    Recreate the "initramfs" file with the following command:

    Note: This command will overwrite the existing "initramfs" file.

    # dracut -f

    Modify the kernel command line of the current kernel in the "grub.cfg" file by adding the following option to the GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX key in the "/etc/default/grub" file and then rebuild the "grub.cfg" file:

    fips=1

    Changes to "/etc/default/grub" require rebuilding the "grub.cfg" file as follows:

    On BIOS-based machines, use the following command:

    # grub2-mkconfig -o /boot/grub2/grub.cfg

    On UEFI-based machines, use the following command:

    # grub2-mkconfig -o /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg

    If /boot or /boot/efi reside on separate partitions, the kernel parameter boot= must be added to the kernel command line. You can identify a partition by running the df /boot or df /boot/efi command:

    # df /boot
    Filesystem 1K-blocks Used Available Use% Mounted on
    /dev/sda1 495844 53780 416464 12% /boot

    To ensure the "boot=" configuration option will work even if device naming changes occur between boots, identify the universally unique identifier (UUID) of the partition with the following command:

    # blkid /dev/sda1
    /dev/sda1: UUID="05c000f1-a213-759e-c7a2-f11b7424c797" TYPE="ext4"

    For the example above, append the following string to the kernel command line:

    boot=UUID=05c000f1-a213-759e-c7a2-f11b7424c797

    If the file /etc/system-fips does not exists, recreate it:

    # touch /etc/ system-fips

    Reboot the system for the changes to take effect.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:126
    Result:false
    Title:Enable FIPS Mode in GRUB2
    Description:Look for argument fips=1 in the kernel line in /etc/default/grub.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (check for fips=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX)
        • false (check for fips=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT)
      • false (check for fips=1 in grub.cfg)
      • false (check for 1 in /proc/sys/crypto/fips_enabled)
      • true (check for fips=0 in /etc/default/grub)
      • false (/etc/system-fips exists)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (redhat-release-virtualization-host RPM package is installed)
          • false (RHEVH base RHEL is version 7)
        • false (redhat-release-client is version 7)
        • false (redhat-release-workstation is version 7)
        • true (redhat-release-server is version 7)
        • false (redhat-release-computenode is version 7)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (Tests whether prelinking is disabled)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (package prelink is removed)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (package dracut-fips is installed)

    V-204502 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have the telnet-server package installed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204502r603261_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-021710
    Identities:V-72077
    SV-86701
    CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

    Operating systems are capable of providing a wide variety of functions and services. Some of the functions and services, provided by default, may not be necessary to support essential organizational operations (e.g., key missions, functions).

    Examples of non-essential capabilities include, but are not limited to, games, software packages, tools, and demonstration software not related to requirements or providing a wide array of functionality not required for every mission, but which cannot be disabled. false
    Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable non-essential capabilities by removing the telnet-server package from the system with the following command:

    # yum remove telnet-server
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1292
    Result:true
    Title:Package telnet-server Removed
    Description:The RPM package telnet-server should be removed.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (package telnet-server is removed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1293 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:true
    Title:package telnet-server is removed
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3007 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'telnet-server'

    V-204594 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon is configured to only use the SSHv2 protocol.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204594r877396_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-040390
    Identities:SV-86875
    V-72251
    CCI-000197 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (c); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (c); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-5 (1) (c))
    CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: SSHv1 is an insecure implementation of the SSH protocol and has many well-known vulnerability exploits. Exploits of the SSH daemon could provide immediate root access to the system.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000074-GPOS-00042, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227 false
    Fix Text:Remove all Protocol lines that reference version "1" in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor). The "Protocol" line must be as follows:

    Protocol 2

    The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1373
    Result:true
    Title:Ensure Only Protocol 2 Connections Allowed
    Description:The OpenSSH daemon should be running protocol 2.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true (sshd uses protocol 2)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (package openssh-server is removed)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (package openssh-server is removed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1374 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:sshd uses protocol 2
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3060 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • behavior requirements:
      • ignore_case = true
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*Protocol[ \t]+([^\s#]*)[ \t]*(?:#.*)?$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:137300 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^(2|"2")$'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8687500 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:true
    Title:package openssh-server is removed
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8687500 (rpminfo_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', evr must be greater than or equal to '0:7.4p1-0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • name equals 'openssh-server'
    • arch equals 'x86_64'
    • epoch equals '(none)'
    • release equals '21.el7'
    • version equals '7.4p1'
    • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
    • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
    • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:false
    Title:package openssh-server is removed
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ not evaluated ]
    • name equals 'openssh-server'
    • arch equals 'x86_64'
    • epoch equals '(none)'
    • release equals '21.el7'
    • version equals '7.4p1'
    • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
    • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
    • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-204606 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not contain .shosts files.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204606r603261_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-040540
    Identities:SV-86901
    V-72277
    CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The .shosts files are used to configure host-based authentication for individual users or the system via SSH. Host-based authentication is not sufficient for preventing unauthorized access to the system, as it does not require interactive identification and authentication of a connection request, or for the use of two-factor authentication. false
    Fix Text:Remove any found ".shosts" files from the system.

    # rm /[path]/[to]/[file]/.shosts
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:86901
    Result:true
    Title:There must be no .shosts files on the system.
    Description:There must be no .shosts files on the system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (There must be no .shosts files on the system.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8690100 (file_test)
    Result:true
    Title:There must be no .shosts files on the system.
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8690100 (file_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • behavior requirements:
      • recurse_file_system = local
      • recurse_direction = down
      • recurse = directories
    • path must be equal to '/'
    • filename must be equal to '.shosts'

    V-204620 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have a File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server package installed unless needed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204620r603261_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-040690
    Identities:SV-86923
    V-72299
    CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The FTP service provides an unencrypted remote access that does not provide for the confidentiality and integrity of user passwords or the remote session. If a privileged user were to log on using this service, the privileged user password could be compromised. SSH or other encrypted file transfer methods must be used in place of this service. false
    Fix Text:Document the "vsftpd" package with the ISSO as an operational requirement or remove it from the system with the following command:

    # yum remove vsftpd
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0

    V-204627 - SNMP community strings on the Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be changed from the default.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204627r603261_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-040800
    Identities:SV-86937
    V-72313
    CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Whether active or not, default Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) community strings must be changed to maintain security. If the service is running with the default authenticators, anyone can gather data about the system and the network and use the information to potentially compromise the integrity of the system or network(s). It is highly recommended that SNMP version 3 user authentication and message encryption be used in place of the version 2 community strings. false
    Fix Text:If the "/etc/snmp/snmpd.conf" file exists, modify any lines that contain a community string value of "public" or "private" to another string value.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1369
    Result:true
    Title:SNMP default communities disabled
    Description:SNMP default communities must be removed.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • true (Check snmpd configuration)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (package net-snmp is removed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1370 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Check snmpd configuration
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3058 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • behavior requirements:
      • ignore_case = true
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/snmp/snmpd.conf'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(com2se|rocommunity|rwcommunity|createUser|authcommunity)[^#]*(public|private)'
    • instance must be equal to '1'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1265 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:true
    Title:package net-snmp is removed
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2991 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'net-snmp'

    V-214799 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the cryptographic hash of system files and commands matches vendor values.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-214799r854001_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:RHEL-07-010020
    Identities:SV-86479
    V-71855
    CCI-001749 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (3))
    Description: Without cryptographic integrity protections, system command and files can be altered by unauthorized users without detection.

    Cryptographic mechanisms used for protecting the integrity of information include, for example, signed hash functions using asymmetric cryptography enabling distribution of the public key to verify the hash information while maintaining the confidentiality of the key used to generate the hash. false
    Fix Text:Run the following command to determine which package owns the file:

    # rpm -qf

    The package can be reinstalled from a yum repository using the command:

    # sudo yum reinstall

    Alternatively, the package can be reinstalled from trusted media using the command:

    # sudo rpm -Uvh
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1340
    Result:false
    Title:Verify File Hashes with RPM
    Description:Verify the RPM digests of system binaries using the RPM database.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (verify file md5 hashes)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1341 (rpmverifyfile_test)
    Result:false
    Title:verify file md5 hashes
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3037 (rpmverifyfile_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • behavior requirements:
      • noconfigfiles = true
      • noghostfiles = true
    • name must match the pattern '.*'
    • epoch must match the pattern '.*'
    • version must match the pattern '.*'
    • release must match the pattern '.*'
    • arch must match the pattern '.*'
    • filepath must match the pattern '^(|/usr|/usr/local)/(bin|sbin|lib|lib64|libexec)/.+$'
    Include Items If:
    • md5_differs equals 'fail'
    Exclude Items If:
    • ghost_file equals 'true'
    Exclude Items If:
    • configuration_file equals 'true'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ not evaluated ]
    • name equals 'openssh-server'
    • epoch equals '(none)'
    • version equals '7.4p1'
    • release equals '21.el7'
    • arch equals 'x86_64'
    • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/sshd-keygen.service'
    • size_differs equals 'fail'
    • mode_differs equals 'pass'
    • md5_differs equals 'fail'
    • filedigest_differs equals 'fail'
    • device_differs equals 'pass'
    • link_mismatch equals 'pass'

    • documentation_file equals '0'

    • license_file equals '0'
    • readme_file equals '0'

    • name equals 'openssh-server'
    • epoch equals '(none)'
    • version equals '7.4p1'
    • release equals '21.el7'
    • arch equals 'x86_64'

    V-204392 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the file permissions, ownership, and group membership of system files and commands match the vendor values.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204392r880752_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:RHEL-07-010010
    Identities:V-71849
    SV-86473
    CCI-001494 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9)
    CCI-001496 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9 (3); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9 (3).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9 (3); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 (3))
    CCI-002165 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3 (4))
    CCI-002235 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (10); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (10))
    Description: Discretionary access control is weakened if a user or group has access permissions to system files and directories greater than the default.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000257-GPOS-00098, SRG-OS-000278-GPOS-00108 false
    Fix Text:Run the following command to determine which package owns the file:

    # rpm -qf

    Reset the user and group ownership of files within a package with the following command:

    # rpm --setugids


    Reset the permissions of files within a package with the following command:

    # rpm --setperms
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Questionnaires:
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.rhel7:questionnaire:1
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the file permissions, ownership, and group membership of system files and commands match the vendor values.
    Description:Discretionary access control is weakened if a user or group has access permissions to system files and directories greater than the default.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000257-GPOS-00098, SRG-OS-000278-GPOS-00108    false
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT I, V-204392, SV-204392r880752, SRG-OS-000257-GPOS-00098)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT I, V-204392, SV-204392r880752, SRG-OS-000257-GPOS-00098
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.rhel7:testaction:1
    Question:Verify the file permissions, ownership, and group membership of system files and commands match the vendor values.

    Check the default file permissions, ownership, and group membership of system files and commands with the following command:

    # for i in `rpm -Va | grep -E '^.{1}M|^.{5}U|^.{6}G' | cut -d " " -f 4,5`;do for j in `rpm -qf $i`;do rpm -ql $j --dump | cut -d " " -f 1,5,6,7 | grep $i;done;done

    /var/log/gdm 040755 root root
    /etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf 0100640 root root
    /usr/bin/passwd 0104755 root root

    For each file returned, verify the current permissions, ownership, and group membership:
    # ls -la

    -rw-------. 1 root root 2017 Nov 1 10:03 /etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf

    If the file is more permissive than the default permissions, this is a finding.

    If the file is not owned by the default owner and is not documented with the Information System Security Officer (ISSO), this is a finding.

    If the file is not a member of the default group and is not documented with the Information System Security Officer (ISSO), this is a finding.

    References:
    V-71849
    SV-86473
    CCI-001494
    CCI-001496
    CCI-002165
    CCI-002235
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-204455 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the x86 Ctrl-Alt-Delete key sequence is disabled on the command line.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204455r833106_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:RHEL-07-020230
    Identities:SV-86617
    V-71993
    CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: A locally logged-on user who presses Ctrl-Alt-Delete, when at the console, can reboot the system. If accidentally pressed, as could happen in the case of a mixed OS environment, this can create the risk of short-term loss of availability of systems due to unintentional reboot. In the GNOME graphical environment, risk of unintentional reboot from the Ctrl-Alt-Delete sequence is reduced because the user will be prompted before any action is taken. false
    Fix Text:Configure the system to disable the Ctrl-Alt-Delete sequence for the command line with the following commands:

    $ sudo systemctl disable ctrl-alt-del.target

    $ sudo systemctl mask ctrl-alt-del.target
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Questionnaires:
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.rhel7:questionnaire:1201
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the x86 Ctrl-Alt-Delete key sequence is disabled on the command line.
    Description:A locally logged-on user who presses Ctrl-Alt-Delete, when at the console, can reboot the system. If accidentally pressed, as could happen in the case of a mixed OS environment, this can create the risk of short-term loss of availability of systems due to unintentional reboot. In the GNOME graphical environment, risk of unintentional reboot from the Ctrl-Alt-Delete sequence is reduced because the user will be prompted before any action is taken.false
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT I, V-204455, SV-204455r833106, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT I, V-204455, SV-204455r833106, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.rhel7:testaction:1201
    Question:Verify the operating system is not configured to reboot the system when Ctrl-Alt-Delete is pressed.

    Check that the ctrl-alt-del.target is masked and not active with the following command:

    $ sudo systemctl status ctrl-alt-del.target

    ctrl-alt-del.target
    Loaded: masked (/dev/null; bad)
    Active: inactive (dead)

    If the ctrl-alt-del.target is not masked, this is a finding.

    If the ctrl-alt-del.target is active, this is a finding.

    References:
    SV-86617
    V-71993
    CCI-000366
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-204456 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the x86 Ctrl-Alt-Delete key sequence is disabled in the Graphical User Interface.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204456r603261_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:RHEL-07-020231
    Identities:V-94843
    SV-104673
    CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: A locally logged-on user who presses Ctrl-Alt-Delete, when at the console, can reboot the system. If accidentally pressed, as could happen in the case of a mixed OS environment, this can create the risk of short-term loss of availability of systems due to unintentional reboot. In the graphical environment, risk of unintentional reboot from the Ctrl-Alt-Delete sequence is reduced because the user will be prompted before any action is taken. false
    Fix Text:Configure the system to disable the Ctrl-Alt-Delete sequence for the graphical user interface with the following command:

    # touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/00-disable-CAD

    Add the setting to disable the Ctrl-Alt-Delete sequence for the graphical user interface:

    [org/gnome/settings-daemon/plugins/media-keys]
    logout=''
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Questionnaires:
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.rhel7:questionnaire:1221
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the x86 Ctrl-Alt-Delete key sequence is disabled in the Graphical User Interface.
    Description:A locally logged-on user who presses Ctrl-Alt-Delete, when at the console, can reboot the system. If accidentally pressed, as could happen in the case of a mixed OS environment, this can create the risk of short-term loss of availability of systems due to unintentional reboot. In the graphical environment, risk of unintentional reboot from the Ctrl-Alt-Delete sequence is reduced because the user will be prompted before any action is taken.false
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT I, V-204456, SV-204456r603261, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT I, V-204456, SV-204456r603261, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.rhel7:testaction:1221
    Question:Note: If the operating system does not have a graphical user interface installed, this requirement is Not Applicable.

    Verify the operating system is not configured to reboot the system when Ctrl-Alt-Delete is pressed.

    Check that the ctrl-alt-del.target is masked and not active in the graphical user interface with the following command:

    # grep logout /etc/dconf/db/local.d/*

    logout=''

    If "logout" is not set to use two single quotations, or is missing, this is a finding.

    References:
    V-94843
    SV-104673
    CCI-000366
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-214801 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use a virus scan program.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-214801r854324_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:RHEL-07-032000
    Identities:V-72213
    SV-86837
    CCI-001668 (NIST SP 800-53: SI-3 a; NIST SP 800-53A: SI-3.1 (ii))
    CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Virus scanning software can be used to protect a system from penetration from computer viruses and to limit their spread through intermediate systems.

    The virus scanning software should be configured to perform scans dynamically on accessed files. If this capability is not available, the system must be configured to scan, at a minimum, all altered files on the system on a daily basis.

    If the system processes inbound SMTP mail, the virus scanner must be configured to scan all received mail. false
    Fix Text:Install an antivirus solution on the system.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Questionnaires:
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.rhel7:questionnaire:4361
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use a virus scan program.
    Description:Virus scanning software can be used to protect a system from penetration from computer viruses and to limit their spread through intermediate systems.

    The virus scanning software should be configured to perform scans dynamically on accessed files. If this capability is not available, the system must be configured to scan, at a minimum, all altered files on the system on a daily basis.

    If the system processes inbound SMTP mail, the virus scanner must be configured to scan all received mail.    false
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT I, V-214801, SV-214801r854324, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT I, V-214801, SV-214801r854324, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.rhel7:testaction:4361
    Question:Verify an anti-virus solution is installed on the system. The anti-virus solution may be bundled with an approved host-based security solution.

    If there is no anti-virus solution installed on the system, this is a finding.

    References:

    V-251702 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have accounts configured with blank or null passwords.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-251702r809220_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:RHEL-07-010291
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: If an account has an empty password, anyone could log on and run commands with the privileges of that account. Accounts with empty passwords should never be used in operational environments. false
    Fix Text:Configure all accounts on the system to have a password or lock the account with the following commands:

    Perform a password reset:
    $ sudo passwd [username]
    Lock an account:
    $ sudo passwd -l [username]
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Questionnaires:
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.rhel7:questionnaire:4641
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have accounts configured with blank or null passwords.
    Description:If an account has an empty password, anyone could log on and run commands with the privileges of that account. Accounts with empty passwords should never be used in operational environments.false
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT I, V-251702, SV-251702r809220, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT I, V-251702, SV-251702r809220, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.rhel7:testaction:4641
    Question:Check the "/etc/shadow" file for blank passwords with the following command:

    $ sudo awk -F: '!$2 {print $1}' /etc/shadow

    If the command returns any results, this is a finding.

    References:
    CCI-000366
    Result:NOT_TESTED

Detailed Results: Medium Severity (CAT II)

    V-204393 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before granting local or remote access to the system via a graphical user logon.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204393r603261_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-010030
    Identities:V-71859
    SV-86483
    CCI-000048 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-8 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-8.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-8 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-8 a)
    Description: Display of a standardized and approved use notification before granting access to the operating system ensures privacy and security notification verbiage used is consistent with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance.

    System use notifications are required only for access via logon interfaces with human users and are not required when such human interfaces do not exist.

    The banner must be formatted in accordance with applicable DoD policy. Use the following verbiage for operating systems that can accommodate banners of 1300 characters:

    "You are accessing a U.S. Government (USG) Information System (IS) that is provided for USG-authorized use only.

    By using this IS (which includes any device attached to this IS), you consent to the following conditions:

    -The USG routinely intercepts and monitors communications on this IS for purposes including, but not limited to, penetration testing, COMSEC monitoring, network operations and defense, personnel misconduct (PM), law enforcement (LE), and counterintelligence (CI) investigations.

    -At any time, the USG may inspect and seize data stored on this IS.

    -Communications using, or data stored on, this IS are not private, are subject to routine monitoring, interception, and search, and may be disclosed or used for any USG-authorized purpose.

    -This IS includes security measures (e.g., authentication and access controls) to protect USG interests--not for your personal benefit or privacy.

    -Notwithstanding the above, using this IS does not constitute consent to PM, LE or CI investigative searching or monitoring of the content of privileged communications, or work product, related to personal representation or services by attorneys, psychotherapists, or clergy, and their assistants. Such communications and work product are private and confidential. See User Agreement for details."


    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000023-GPOS-00006, SRG-OS-000024-GPOS-00007, SRG-OS-000228-GPOS-00088 false
    Fix Text:Configure the operating system to display the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before granting access to the system.

    Note: If the system does not have GNOME installed, this requirement is Not Applicable.

    Create a database to contain the system-wide graphical user logon settings (if it does not already exist) with the following command:

    # touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/01-banner-message

    Add the following line to the [org/gnome/login-screen] section of the "/etc/dconf/db/local.d/01-banner-message":

    [org/gnome/login-screen]
    banner-message-enable=true

    Update the system databases:

    # dconf update

    Users must log out and back in again before the system-wide settings take effect.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:922
    Result:true
    Title:Enable GNOME3 Login Warning Banner
    Description:Enable the GNOME3 Login warning banner.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (GUI banner is enabled)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (dconf user profile exists)
          • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
            • false (package dconf is installed)
      • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
        • false (package dconf is installed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:925 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:GUI banner is enabled
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2720 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • behavior requirements:
      • max_depth = 1
      • recurse_direction = down
    • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db'
    • filename must match the pattern '^[0-9].*$'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\[org/gnome/login-screen\]([^\n]*\n+)+?banner-message-enable\s*=\s*true\s*$'
    • instance must be equal to '1'
    Include Items If:
    • path matches the pattern '^/etc/dconf/db/[^/]+\.d/?$'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1022 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:dconf user profile exists
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2792 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/dconf/profile/user'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^user-db:user\nsystem-db:local$'
    • instance must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1252 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:false
    Title:package dconf is installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2983 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'dconf'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-204396 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must enable a user session lock until that user re-establishes access using established identification and authentication procedures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204396r880746_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-010060
    Identities:SV-86515
    V-71891
    CCI-000056 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-11 b; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-11.1 (iii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-11 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-11 b)
    Description: A session lock is a temporary action taken when a user stops work and moves away from the immediate physical vicinity of the information system but does not want to log out because of the temporary nature of the absence.

    The session lock is implemented at the point where session activity can be determined.

    Regardless of where the session lock is determined and implemented, once invoked, the session lock must remain in place until the user reauthenticates. No other activity aside from reauthentication must unlock the system.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000028-GPOS-00009, SRG-OS-000030-GPOS-00011 false
    Fix Text:Configure the operating system to enable a user's session lock until that user re-establishes access using established identification and authentication procedures.

    Create a database to contain the system-wide screensaver settings (if it does not already exist) with the following example:

    # touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/00-screensaver

    Edit the "[org/gnome/desktop/screensaver]" section of the database file and add or update the following lines:

    # Set this to true to lock the screen when the screensaver activates
    lock-enabled=true

    Update the system databases:

    # dconf update

    Users must log out and back in again before the system-wide settings take effect.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:988
    Result:true
    Title:Enable GNOME3 Screensaver Lock After Idle Period
    Description:Idle activation of the screen lock should be enabled.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (screensaver lock is enabled)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (dconf user profile exists)
          • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
            • false (package dconf is installed)
      • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
        • false (package dconf is installed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:989 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:screensaver lock is enabled
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2767 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • behavior requirements:
      • max_depth = 1
      • recurse_direction = down
    • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db/'
    • filename must match the pattern '^[0-9].*$'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\[org/gnome/desktop/screensaver\]([^\n]*\n+)+?lock-enabled\s*=\s*true\s*$'
    • instance must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1022 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:dconf user profile exists
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2792 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/dconf/profile/user'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^user-db:user\nsystem-db:local$'
    • instance must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1252 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:false
    Title:package dconf is installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2983 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'dconf'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-204397 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must uniquely identify and must authenticate users using multifactor authentication via a graphical user logon.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204397r853879_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-010061
    Identities:V-77819
    SV-92515
    CCI-001948 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (11))
    CCI-001953 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
    CCI-001954 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
    Description: To assure accountability and prevent unauthenticated access, users must be identified and authenticated to prevent potential misuse and compromise of the system.

    Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00161,SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00162 false
    Fix Text:Configure the operating system to uniquely identify and authenticate users using multifactor authentication via a graphical user logon.

    Note: If the system does not have GNOME installed, this requirement is Not Applicable.

    Create a database to contain the system-wide screensaver settings (if it does not already exist) with the following command:

    Note: The example is using the database local for the system, so if the system is using another database in "/etc/dconf/profile/user", the file should be created under the appropriate subdirectory.

    # touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/00-defaults

    Edit "[org/gnome/login-screen]" and add or update the following line:
    enable-smartcard-authentication=true

    Update the system databases:
    # dconf update
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:92515
    Result:true
    Title:Smartcard authentication enabled for graphical user logon.
    Description:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must uniquely identify and must authenticate users using multifactor authentication via a graphical user logon.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (check for enable-smartcard-authentication set to true)
        • true (check for enable-smartcard-authentication set to false) (negated)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (dconf user profile exists)
          • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
            • false (package dconf is installed)
      • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
        • false (package dconf is installed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9251500 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:check for enable-smartcard-authentication set to true
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9251500 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • behavior requirements:
      • recurse_direction = down
    • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db/'
    • filename must match the pattern '^[0-9].*$'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*\[org/gnome/login-screen\](?:[^\n]*\n+)+?enable-smartcard-authentication\s*=\s*(\w+)\s*$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9251500 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^true$'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9251501 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:check for enable-smartcard-authentication set to false
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9251500 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • behavior requirements:
      • recurse_direction = down
    • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db/'
    • filename must match the pattern '^[0-9].*$'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*\[org/gnome/login-screen\](?:[^\n]*\n+)+?enable-smartcard-authentication\s*=\s*(\w+)\s*$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9251501 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^false$'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1022 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:dconf user profile exists
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2792 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/dconf/profile/user'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^user-db:user\nsystem-db:local$'
    • instance must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1252 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:false
    Title:package dconf is installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2983 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'dconf'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-204398 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must initiate a screensaver after a 15-minute period of inactivity for graphical user interfaces.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204398r880770_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-010070
    Identities:V-71893
    SV-86517
    CCI-000057 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-11 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-11.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-11 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-11 a)
    Description: A session time-out lock is a temporary action taken when a user stops work and moves away from the immediate physical vicinity of the information system but does not log out because of the temporary nature of the absence. Rather than relying on the user to manually lock their operating system session prior to vacating the vicinity, operating systems need to be able to identify when a user's session has idled and take action to initiate the session lock.

    The session lock is implemented at the point where session activity can be determined and/or controlled. false
    Fix Text:Configure the operating system to initiate a screensaver after a 15-minute period of inactivity for graphical user interfaces.

    Create a database to contain the system-wide screensaver settings (if it does not already exist) with the following command:

    # touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/00-screensaver

    Edit /etc/dconf/db/local.d/00-screensaver and add or update the following lines:

    [org/gnome/desktop/session]
    # Set the lock time out to 900 seconds before the session is considered idle
    idle-delay=uint32 900

    You must include the "uint32" along with the integer key values as shown.

    Update the system databases:

    # dconf update

    Users must log out and back in again before the system-wide settings take effect.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:981
    Result:true
    Title:Configure the GNOME3 GUI Screen locking
    Description:The allowed period of inactivity before the screensaver is activated.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (screensaver idle delay is configured)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (dconf user profile exists)
          • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
            • false (package dconf is installed)
      • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
        • false (package dconf is installed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:982 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:screensaver idle delay is configured
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2761 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • behavior requirements:
      • max_depth = 1
      • recurse_direction = down
    • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db/'
    • filename must match the pattern '^[0-9].*$'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\[org/gnome/desktop/session\](?:[^\n]*\n+)+?idle-delay\s*=\s*uint32[\s]+([0-9]*)'
    • instance must be equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2764 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for check = 'all', subexpression, all of the following must be true:
      • subexpression must be less than or equal to '900'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1022 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:dconf user profile exists
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2792 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/dconf/profile/user'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^user-db:user\nsystem-db:local$'
    • instance must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1252 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:false
    Title:package dconf is installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2983 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'dconf'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-204399 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent a user from overriding the screensaver lock-delay setting for the graphical user interface.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204399r880773_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:RHEL-07-010081
    Identities:V-73155
    SV-87807
    CCI-000057 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-11 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-11.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-11 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-11 a)
    Description: A session time-out lock is a temporary action taken when a user stops work and moves away from the immediate physical vicinity of the information system but does not log out because of the temporary nature of the absence. Rather than relying on the user to manually lock their operating system session prior to vacating the vicinity, operating systems need to be able to identify when a user's session has idled and take action to initiate the session lock.

    The session lock is implemented at the point where session activity can be determined and/or controlled. false
    Fix Text:Configure the operating system to prevent a user from overriding a screensaver lock after a 15-minute period of inactivity for graphical user interfaces.

    Create a database to contain the system-wide screensaver settings (if it does not already exist) with the following command:

    Note: The example below is using the database "local" for the system, so if the system is using another database in "/etc/dconf/profile/user", the file should be created under the appropriate subdirectory.

    # touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/locks/session

    Add the setting to lock the screensaver lock delay:

    /org/gnome/desktop/screensaver/lock-delay
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
    Identifier:2899
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:999
    Result:true
    Title:Gnome lock-delay setting lock
    Description:Determines if the databases containing the lock-delay setting also have the setting locked.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (lock-delay configuration is present)
        • false (lock-delay lock exists)
        • true (all lock-delay entries are locked)
      • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
        • false (package dconf is installed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8780700 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:lock-delay configuration is present
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2765 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • behavior requirements:
      • max_depth = 1
      • recurse_direction = down
    • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db/'
    • filename must match the pattern '^[0-9].*$'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\[org/gnome/desktop/screensaver\]([^\n]*\n+)+?lock-delay\s*=\s*uint32\s+[0-5]\s*$'
    • instance must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8780702 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:lock-delay lock exists
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8780700 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • behavior requirements:
      • max_depth = 1
      • recurse_direction = down
    • for path, at least one of the following must be true:
      • path must be equal to '/locks'
    • filename must match the pattern '^.*$'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^/org/gnome/desktop/screensaver/lock-delay$'
    • instance must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8780701 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:all lock-delay entries are locked
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8780701 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • for check = 'all', path, at least one of the following must be true:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1252 (rpminfo_test)
      Result:false
      Title:package dconf is installed
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.

      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      V-204402 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must initiate a session lock for the screensaver after a period of inactivity for graphical user interfaces.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204402r880782_rule
      Test Type:Automated
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-010100
      Identities:V-71899
      SV-86523
      CCI-000057 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-11 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-11.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-11 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-11 a)
      Description: A session time-out lock is a temporary action taken when a user stops work and moves away from the immediate physical vicinity of the information system but does not log out because of the temporary nature of the absence. Rather than relying on the user to manually lock their operating system session prior to vacating the vicinity, operating systems need to be able to identify when a user's session has idled and take action to initiate the session lock.

      The session lock is implemented at the point where session activity can be determined and/or controlled. false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to initiate a session lock after a 15-minute period of inactivity for graphical user interfaces.

      Create a database to contain the system-wide screensaver settings (if it does not already exist) with the following command:

      # touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/00-screensaver

      Add the setting to enable screensaver locking after 15 minutes of inactivity:

      [org/gnome/desktop/screensaver]

      idle-activation-enabled=true

      Update the system databases:

      # dconf update

      Users must log out and back in again before the system-wide settings take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (idle delay is configured)
          • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (dconf user profile exists)
            • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
              • false (package dconf is installed)
        • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • false (package dconf is installed)

      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2759 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • behavior requirements:
        • max_depth = 1
        • recurse_direction = down
      • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db/'
      • filename must match the pattern '^[0-9].*$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^\[org/gnome/desktop/screensaver\]([^\n]*\n+)+?idle-activation-enabled\s*=\s*true\s*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1022 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:dconf user profile exists
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.

      V-204403 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent a user from overriding the screensaver idle-activation-enabled setting for the graphical user interface.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204403r880785_rule
      Test Type:Automated
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-010101
      Identities:V-78997
      SV-93703
      CCI-000057 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-11 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-11.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-11 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-11 a)
      Description: A session lock is a temporary action taken when a user stops work and moves away from the immediate physical vicinity of the information system but does not want to log out because of the temporary nature of the absence.

      The session lock is implemented at the point where session activity can be determined.

      The ability to enable/disable a session lock is given to the user by default. Disabling the user's ability to disengage the graphical user interface session lock provides the assurance that all sessions will lock after the specified period of time. false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to prevent a user from overriding a screensaver lock after a 15-minute period of inactivity for graphical user interfaces.

      Create a database to contain the system-wide screensaver settings (if it does not already exist) with the following command:

      Note: The example below is using the database "local" for the system, so if the system is using another database in "/etc/dconf/profile/user", the file should be created under the appropriate subdirectory.

      # touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/locks/session

      Add the setting to lock the screensaver idle-activation-enabled setting:

      /org/gnome/desktop/screensaver/idle-activation-enabled
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:93703
      Result:true
      Title:The operating system must prevent a user from overriding the screensaver idle-activation-enabled setting for the graphical user interface.
      Description:A session lock is a temporary action taken when a user stops work and moves away from the immediate physical vicinity of the information system but does not want to log out because of the temporary nature of the absence.

      The session lock is implemented at the point where session activity can be determined.

      The ability to enable/disable a session lock is given to the user by default. Disabling the user's ability to disengage the graphical user interface session lock provides the assurance that all sessions will lock after the specified period of time.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (idle-activation-enabled configuration is present)
          • false (idle-activation-enabled lock exists)
          • true (all idle-activation-enabled entries are locked)
        • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • false (package dconf is installed)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9370300 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:idle-activation-enabled configuration is present
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9370300 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • behavior requirements:
        • max_depth = 1
        • recurse_direction = down
      • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db/'
      • filename must match the pattern '^[0-9].*$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^\[org/gnome/desktop/screensaver\]([^\n]*\n+)+?idle-activation-enabled\s*=\s*(?:true|false)\s*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9370302 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:idle-activation-enabled lock exists
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9370302 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • behavior requirements:
        • max_depth = 1
        • recurse_direction = down
      • for path, at least one of the following must be true:
        • path must be equal to '/locks'
      • filename must match the pattern '^.*$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^/org/gnome/desktop/screensaver/idle-activation-enabled\s*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9370301 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:all idle-activation-enabled entries are locked
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9370301 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • Collect any available items.
      Exclude Items If:
      • for check = 'all', path, at least one of the following must be true:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1252 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package dconf is installed
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.

        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204404 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must initiate a session lock for graphical user interfaces when the screensaver is activated.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204404r880788_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Pass
        Version:RHEL-07-010110
        Identities:V-71901
        SV-86525
        CCI-000057 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-11 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-11.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-11 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-11 a)
        Description: A session time-out lock is a temporary action taken when a user stops work and moves away from the immediate physical vicinity of the information system but does not log out because of the temporary nature of the absence. Rather than relying on the user to manually lock their operating system session prior to vacating the vicinity, operating systems need to be able to identify when a user's session has idled and take action to initiate the session lock.

        The session lock is implemented at the point where session activity can be determined and/or controlled. false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to initiate a session lock for graphical user interfaces when a screensaver is activated.

        Create a database to contain the system-wide screensaver settings (if it does not already exist) with the following command:

        # touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/00-screensaver

        Add the setting to enable session locking when a screensaver is activated:

        [org/gnome/desktop/screensaver]
        lock-delay=uint32 5

        The "uint32" must be included along with the integer key values as shown.

        Update the system databases:

        # dconf update

        Users must log out and back in again before the system-wide settings take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:

          • recurse_direction = down
