        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204531 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the creat, open, openat, open_by_handle_at, truncate, and ftruncate syscalls.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204531r853917_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030510
        Identities:SV-86749
        V-72125
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
        Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

        Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

        When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

        The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall made by all programs on the system. Therefore, it is very important to use syscall rules only when absolutely necessary since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. The performance can be helped, however, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000461-GPOS-00205, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records upon successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "creat", "open", "openat", "open_by_handle_at", "truncate", and "ftruncate" syscalls.

        Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S creat,open,openat,open_by_handle_at,truncate,ftruncate -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k access

        -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S creat,open,openat,open_by_handle_at,truncate,ftruncate -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k access

        -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S creat,open,openat,open_by_handle_at,truncate,ftruncate -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k access

        -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S creat,open,openat,open_by_handle_at,truncate,ftruncate -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k access

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:805
        Result:false
        Title:RHEL-07-030510 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the creat, open, openat, open_by_handle_at, truncate and ftruncate syscalls.
        Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

        Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

        When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.
        The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall that all programs on the system makes. Therefore, it is very important to only use syscall rules when you have to since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. You can help the performance, though, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:

            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)
        Tests:

        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:851 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit auditctl 32-bit file eaccess
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2662 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b32[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+truncate[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])truncate([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+exit=\-EACCES[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:852 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit auditctl 32-bit file eperm
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2663 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b32[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+truncate[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])truncate([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+exit=\-EPERM[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit auditctl
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204536 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the semanage command.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204536r861014_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030560
        Identities:SV-86759
        V-72135
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
        Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

        Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

        When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000465-GPOS-00209 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "semanage" command occur.

        Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/semanage -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-priv_change

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:618
        Result:false
        Title:Record Any Attempts to Run semanage
        Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of semanage is enabled.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit augenrules semanage)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl semanage)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:619 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit augenrules semanage
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2484 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/sbin\/semanage[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*)?x([rwa]*)?[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:true
        Title:audit augenrules
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ not evaluated ]
        • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
        • filename equals 'auditd.service'
        • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
        • instance equals '1'
        • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
        • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
        • subexpression does not exist
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:620 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit auditctl semanage
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2485 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/sbin\/semanage[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*)?x([rwa]*)?[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit auditctl
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
        • subexpression does not exist
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8676501 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit auditctl restorecon
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8676501 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=(\/usr)?\/sbin\/setfiles[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit auditctl
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204540 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all unsuccessful account access events.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204540r853930_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030610
        Identities:V-72145
        SV-86769
        CCI-000126 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-2.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-2 c)
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
        Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

        Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000473-GPOS-00218 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when unsuccessful account access events occur.

        Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -w /var/run/faillock -p wa -k logins

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:675
        Result:false
        Title:Record Attempts to Alter Login and Logout Events - faillock
        Description:Audit rules should be configured to log successful and unsuccessful login and logout events.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit augenrules faillock)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl faillock)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:677 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit augenrules faillock
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2524 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^\-w\s+/var/run/faillock/?\s+\-p\s+\b([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*)\b\s+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)

        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

        V-204541 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all successful account access events.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204541r853931_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030620
        Identities:V-72147
        SV-86771
        CCI-000126 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-2.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-2 c)
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))

        V-204542 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the passwd command.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204542r861026_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030630
        Identities:SV-86773
        V-72149
        CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
        Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

        At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged password commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

        When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "passwd" command occur.

        Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/passwd -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-passwd

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:733
        Result:false
        Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - passwd
        Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of passwd is enabled.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit augenrules passwd)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl passwd)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:734 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit augenrules passwd
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2570 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/passwd[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:true
        Title:audit augenrules
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ not evaluated ]
        • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
        • filename equals 'auditd.service'
        • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
        • instance equals '1'
        • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
        • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
        • subexpression does not exist
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:735 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit auditctl passwd
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2571 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/passwd[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit auditctl
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

        V-204543 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the unix_chkpwd command.

        V-204544 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the gpasswd command.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204544r861032_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030650
        Identities:SV-86777
        V-72153
        CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
        Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

        At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged password commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

        When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "gpasswd" command occur.

        Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/gpasswd -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-passwd

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:724
        Result:false
        Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - gpasswd
        Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of gpasswd is enabled.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit augenrules gpasswd)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl gpasswd)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:725 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit augenrules gpasswd
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2564 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/gpasswd[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:true
        Title:audit augenrules
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ not evaluated ]
        • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
        • filename equals 'auditd.service'
        • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
        • instance equals '1'
        • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
        • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
        • subexpression does not exist
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:726 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit auditctl gpasswd
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2565 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/gpasswd[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false

        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.

        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

        V-204548 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the sudo command.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204548r861044_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030690
        Identities:V-72161
        SV-86785
        CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
        CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
        Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

        At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged access commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

        When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "sudo" command occur.

        Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/sudo -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-priv_change

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:751
        Result:false
        Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - sudo
        Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of sudo is enabled.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit augenrules sudo)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl sudo)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:752 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit augenrules sudo
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2582 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/sudo[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:true
        Title:audit augenrules
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ not evaluated ]
        • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
        • filename equals 'auditd.service'
        • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
        • instance equals '1'
        • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
        • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
        • subexpression does not exist
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:753 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit auditctl sudo
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2583 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/sudo[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit auditctl
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204549 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the sudoers file and all files in the /etc/sudoers.d/ directory.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204549r853953_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030700
        Identities:V-72163
        SV-86787
        CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
        CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
        Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

        At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged access commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to access the "/etc/sudoers" file and files in the "/etc/sudoers.d/" directory.

        Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -w /etc/sudoers -p wa -k privileged-actions

        -w /etc/sudoers.d/ -p wa -k privileged-actions

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:773
        Result:false
        Title:Audit System Administrator Actions
        Description:Audit actions taken by system administrators on the system.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit augenrules sudoers)
            • false (audit augenrules sudoers.d)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl sudoers)
            • false (audit auditctl sudoers.d)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:774 (textfilecontent54_test)

        • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^\-w[\s]+/etc/sudoers[\s]+\-p[\s]+\b([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*)\b[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204550 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the newgrp command.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204550r861047_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030710
        Identities:V-72165
        SV-86789
        CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
        CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
        Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

        At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged access commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

        When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false

        V-204551 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chsh command.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204551r861050_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030720
        Identities:SV-86791
        V-72167
        CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)

        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2561 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/chsh[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit auditctl
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204552 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the mount command and syscall.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204552r861053_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030740
        Identities:V-72171
        SV-86795
        CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
        CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
        Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

        At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged mount commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

        When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "mount" command and syscall occur.

        Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S mount -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount
        -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S mount -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount
        -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/mount -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:686
        Result:false
        Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the mount command and syscall.
        Description:Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is no possible if audit records do not contain enough information.
        At a minimum, the orginization must audit the full-text recording of privileged mount commands. The orginization must maintain audit
        trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit augenrules /bin/mount)
              • false (audit augenrules /usr/bin/mount)
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit augenrules mount 64-bit)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
                • true (All child checks must be true.)
                  • true (64 bit architecture)
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (audit augenrules mount 32-bit)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl /bin/mount)
              • false (audit auditctl /usr/bin/mount)
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl mount 64-bit)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
                • true (All child checks must be true.)
                  • true (64 bit architecture)
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (audit auditctl mount 32-bit)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:68600 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit augenrules /bin/mount
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:68600 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^\-a\s+always,exit\s+(?:(\-F[\s]+path=\/bin\/mount[\s]+))(-F\s+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)\s+)?(?:-F\s+auid>=1000\s+\-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)\s+)(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:68601 (textfilecontent54_test)

        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

        V-204553 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the umount command.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204553r861056_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030750
        Identities:V-72173
        SV-86797
        CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
        CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
        Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

        At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged mount commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

        When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "umount" command occur.

        Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/umount -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:757
        Result:false
        Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - umount
        Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of umount is enabled.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit augenrules umount)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl umount)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:758 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit augenrules umount
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2586 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=(\/usr)?\/bin\/umount[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:true
        Title:audit augenrules
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ not evaluated ]
        • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
        • filename equals 'auditd.service'
        • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
        • instance equals '1'
        • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
        • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
        • subexpression does not exist
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:759 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false

        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.

        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204554 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the postdrop command.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204554r861059_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030760
        Identities:V-72175
        SV-86799
        CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
        CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
        Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

        At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged postfix commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

        When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "postdrop" command occur.

        Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/postdrop -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-postfix

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:736
        Result:false
        Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - postdrop
        Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of postdrop is enabled.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit augenrules postdrop)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl postdrop)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:737 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit augenrules postdrop
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2572 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/sbin\/postdrop[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'

        V-204555 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the postqueue command.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204555r861062_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030770
        Identities:SV-86801
        V-72177
        CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
        CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
        Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

        At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged postfix commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

        When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "postqueue" command occur.

        Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/postqueue -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-postfix

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:739
        Result:false
        Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - postqueue
        Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of postqueue is enabled.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit augenrules postqueue)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl postqueue)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:740 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit augenrules postqueue
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2574 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/sbin\/postqueue[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:true
        Title:audit augenrules
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ not evaluated ]
        • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
        • filename equals 'auditd.service'
        • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
        • instance equals '1'
        • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
        • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
        • subexpression does not exist
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:741 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false

        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2575 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/sbin\/postqueue[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)

        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

        V-204556 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the ssh-keysign command.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204556r861065_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030780
        Identities:SV-86803
        V-72179
        CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
        Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

        At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged ssh commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

        When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "ssh-keysign" command occur.

        Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -a always,exit -F path=/usr/libexec/openssh/ssh-keysign -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-ssh

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA

          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit augenrules ssh_keysign)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl ssh_keysign)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)

        V-204558 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the pam_timestamp_check command.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204558r833166_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030810
        Identities:V-72185
        SV-86809
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

        When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way. false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "pam_timestamp_check" command occur.

        Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/pam_timestamp_check -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-pam

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:730
        Result:false
        Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - pam_timestamp_check
        Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of pam_timestamp_check is enabled.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit augenrules pam_timestamp_check)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl pam_timestamp_check)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)

        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:731 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false

        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2568 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=(\/usr)?\/sbin\/pam_timestamp_check[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:true
        Title:audit augenrules
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ not evaluated ]

        V-204559 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the create_module syscall.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204559r833169_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030819
        Identities:V-78999
        SV-93705
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

        Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00216, SRG-OS-000477-GPOS-00222 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "create_module" syscall occur.

        Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S create_module -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k module-change

        -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S create_module -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k module-change

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:93705
        Result:false
        Title:Audit Kernel Module Creation - create_module
        Description:The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module creation.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit augenrules 64-bit create_module)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
                • true (All child checks must be true.)
                  • true (64 bit architecture)
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (audit augenrules 32-bit create_module)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl 64-bit create_module)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
                • true (All child checks must be true.)
                  • true (64 bit architecture)
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (audit auditctl 32-bit create_module)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)

        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+create_module[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])create_module([\s]+|[,]))).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'

        V-204560 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the init_module and finit_module syscalls.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204560r833172_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030820
        Identities:V-72187
        SV-86811
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

        Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

        The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall made by all programs on the system. Therefore, it is very important to use syscall rules only when absolutely necessary since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. The performance can be helped, however, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00216, SRG-OS-000477-GPOS-00222 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records upon successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "init_module" and "finit_module" syscalls.

        Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S init_module,finit_module -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k modulechange

        -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S init_module,finit_module -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k modulechange

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:657
        Result:false
        Title:RHEL-07-030820 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the init_module and finit_module syscalls.
        Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

        Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).
        The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall that all programs on the system makes. Therefore, it is very important to only use syscall rules when you have to since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. You can help the performance, though, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit augenrules 64-bit init_module)
              • false (audit augenrules 64-bit finit_module)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
                • true (All child checks must be true.)
                  • true (64 bit architecture)
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (audit augenrules 32-bit init_module)
            • false (audit augenrules 32-bit finit_module)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl 64-bit init_module)
              • false (audit auditctl 64-bit finit_module)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
                • true (All child checks must be true.)
                  • true (64 bit architecture)
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (audit auditctl 32-bit init_module)
            • false (audit auditctl 32-bit finit_module)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:664 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit augenrules 64-bit init_module
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2515 (textfilecontent54_object)

        • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'

        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+init_module[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])init_module([\s]+|[,]))).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9370702 (textfilecontent54_test)

        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:665 (textfilecontent54_test)

        Title:audit auditctl 32-bit init_module
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
