        V-204562 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the delete_module syscall.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204562r833175_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030830
        Identities:V-72189
        SV-86813
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

        Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00216, SRG-OS-000477-GPOS-00222 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "delete_module" syscall occur.

        Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S delete_module -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k module-change

        -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S delete_module -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k module-change

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:658
        Result:false
        Title:Audit Kernel Module Loading and Unloading - delete_module
        Description:The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module loading and unloading.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit augenrules 64-bit delete_module)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
                • true (All child checks must be true.)
                  • true (64 bit architecture)
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (audit augenrules 32-bit delete_module)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl 64-bit delete_module)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
                • true (All child checks must be true.)
                  • true (64 bit architecture)
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (audit auditctl 32-bit delete_module)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)
        Tests:

        Check:Result is based on check existence only.

        V-204563 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the kmod command.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204563r858498_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030840
        Identities:SV-86815
        V-72191
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

        Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

        When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00216, SRG-OS-000477-GPOS-00222 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "kmod" command occur.

        Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/kmod -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k modules

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:86815
        Result:false
        Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - kmod
        Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of kmod is enabled.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit augenrules kmod)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl kmod)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8681500 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit augenrules kmod
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8681500 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+path=\/usr\/bin\/kmod\s+(-F\s+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\S+)?\s*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:true
        Title:audit augenrules
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ not evaluated ]
        • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
        • filename equals 'auditd.service'
        • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
        • instance equals '1'
        • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
        • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
        • subexpression does not exist
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8681501 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit auditctl kmod
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8681501 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+path=\/usr\/bin\/kmod\s+(-F\s+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\S+)?\s*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit auditctl
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204564 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/passwd.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204564r853978_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030870
        Identities:SV-86821
        V-72197
        CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
        CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
        Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

        Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect "/etc/passwd".

        Add or update the following rule "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -w /etc/passwd -p wa -k identity

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:875

        Class:compliance

          • false (All child checks must be true.)

            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit /etc/passwd)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)
        Tests:

        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2682 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^\-w[\s]+/etc/passwd[\s]+\-p[\s]+\b([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*)\b[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)\w+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'

        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Collected Item/State Result:

        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204565 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/group.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204565r853979_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030871
        Identities:SV-87817
        V-73165
        CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
        CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
        Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

        Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect "/etc/group".

        Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -w /etc/group -p wa -k identity

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:

        Result:false
        Title:Audit User/Group Modification (/etc/group)

        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit augenrules /etc/group)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit /etc/group)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)

        Check:Result is based on check existence only.

        V-204568 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/security/opasswd.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204568r853982_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030874

        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))

        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/security/opasswd.

        -w /etc/security/opasswd -p wa -k identity

        V-204572 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the unlink, unlinkat, rename, renameat, and rmdir syscalls.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204572r853985_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-030910
        Identities:V-72205
        SV-86829
        CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
        CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
        Description: If the system is not configured to audit certain activities and write them to an audit log, it is more difficult to detect and track system compromises and damages incurred during a system compromise.

        When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

        The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall made by all programs on the system. Therefore, it is very important to use syscall rules only when absolutely necessary since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. The performance can be helped, however, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000467-GPOS-00211, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records upon successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "unlink", "unlinkat", "rename", "renameat", and "rmdir" syscalls.

        Add the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

        -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S unlink,unlinkat,rename,renameat,rmdir -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k delete

        -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S unlink,unlinkat,rename,renameat,rmdir -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k delete

        The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:626
        Result:false
        Title:RHEL-07-030910 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the unlink, unlinkat, rename, renameat and rmdir syscalls.
        Description:If the system is not configured to audit certain activities and write them to an audit log, it is more difficult to detect and track system compromises and damages incurred during a system compromise.

        When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.
        The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall that all programs on the system makes. Therefore, it is very important to only use syscall rules when you have to since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. You can help the performance, though, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit augenrules 64-bit unlink)
              • false (audit augenrules 64-bit rmdir)
              • false (audit augenrules 64-bit unlinkat)
              • false (audit augenrules 64-bit rename)
              • false (audit augenrules 64-bit renameat)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
                • true (All child checks must be true.)
                  • true (64 bit architecture)
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (audit augenrules 32-bit unlink)
            • false (audit augenrules 32-bit rmdir)
            • false (audit augenrules 32-bit unlinkat)
            • false (audit augenrules 32-bit rename)
            • false (audit augenrules 32-bit renameat)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (audit augenrules)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl 64-bit unlink)
              • false (audit auditctl 64-bit rmdir)
              • false (audit auditctl 64-bit unlinkat)
              • false (audit auditctl 64-bit rename)
              • false (audit auditctl 64-bit renameat)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
                • true (All child checks must be true.)
                  • true (64 bit architecture)
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
                  • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (audit auditctl 32-bit unlink)
            • false (audit auditctl 32-bit rmdir)
            • false (audit auditctl 32-bit unlinkat)
            • false (audit auditctl 32-bit rename)
            • false (audit auditctl 32-bit renameat)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:643 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit augenrules 64-bit unlink
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2501 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+unlink[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])unlink([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b32[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+renameat[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])renameat([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:audit auditctl
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204578 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 operating system must implement DoD-approved encryption to protect the confidentiality of SSH connections.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204578r877398_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040110
        Identities:V-72221
        SV-86845
        CCI-000068 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-17 (2))
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        CCI-000803 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-7; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-7.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-7; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-7)
        Description: Unapproved mechanisms that are used for authentication to the cryptographic module are not verified and therefore cannot be relied upon to provide confidentiality or integrity, and DoD data may be compromised.

        Operating systems utilizing encryption are required to use FIPS-compliant mechanisms for authenticating to cryptographic modules.

        FIPS 140-2 is the current standard for validating that mechanisms used to access cryptographic modules utilize authentication that meets DoD requirements. This allows for Security Levels 1, 2, 3, or 4 for use on a general purpose computing system.

        The system will attempt to use the first cipher presented by the client that matches the server list. Listing the values "strongest to weakest" is a method to ensure the use of the strongest cipher available to secure the SSH connection.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000033-GPOS-00014, SRG-OS-000120-GPOS-00061, SRG-OS-000125-GPOS-00065, SRG-OS-000250-GPOS-00093, SRG-OS-000393-GPOS-00173 false
        Fix Text:Configure SSH to use FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic algorithms.

        Add the following line (or modify the line to have the required value) to the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor).

        Ciphers aes256-ctr,aes192-ctr,aes128-ctr

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1399
        Result:false
        Title:RHEL-07-040110 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 operating system must implement DoD-approved encryption to protect the confidentiality of SSH connections
        Description:Unapproved mechanisms that are used for authentication to the cryptographic module are not verified and therefore cannot be relied upon to provide confidentiality or integrity, and DoD data may be compromised.

        Operating systems utilizing encryption are required to use FIPS-compliant mechanisms for authenticating to cryptographic modules.

        FIPS 140-2 is the current standard for validating that mechanisms used to access cryptographic modules utilize authentication that meets DoD requirements. This allows for Security Levels 1, 2, 3, or 4 for use on a general purpose computing system.

        By specifying a cipher list with the order of ciphers being in a "strongest to weakest" orientation, the system will automatically attempt to use the strongest cipher for securing SSH connections.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (tests the value of Ciphers setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1400 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:tests the value of Ciphers setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3078 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • behavior requirements:
          • ignore_case = true
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*Ciphers[\s]+(.*)'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:3078 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^"?(aes256-ctr,aes192-ctr,aes128-ctr)"?[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package openssh-server is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ not evaluated ]
        • name equals 'openssh-server'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'
        • release equals '21.el7'
        • version equals '7.4p1'
        • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
        • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
        • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204579 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all network connections associated with a communication session are terminated at the end of the session or after 15 minutes of inactivity from the user at a command prompt, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204579r861070_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040160
        Identities:SV-86847
        V-72223
        CCI-001133 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-10; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-10.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-10; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-10)
        CCI-002361 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-12; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-12)
        Description: Terminating an idle session within a short time period reduces the window of opportunity for unauthorized personnel to take control of a management session enabled on the console or console port that has been left unattended. In addition, quickly terminating an idle session will also free up resources committed by the managed network element.

        Terminating network connections associated with communications sessions includes, for example, de-allocating associated TCP/IP address/port pairs at the operating system level and de-allocating networking assignments at the application level if multiple application sessions are using a single operating system-level network connection. This does not mean that the operating system terminates all sessions or network access; it only ends the inactive session and releases the resources associated with that session.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000029-GPOS-00010, SRG-OS-000163-GPOS-00072 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to terminate all network connections associated with a communications session at the end of the session or after a period of inactivity.

        Create a script to enforce the inactivity timeout (for example /etc/profile.d/tmout.sh) such as:

        #!/bin/bash

        declare -xr TMOUT=900
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:510
        Result:false
        Title:RHEL-07-040160 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all network connections associated with a communication session are terminated at the end of the session or after 15 minutes of inactivity from the user at a command prompt, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements.
        Description:Terminating an idle session within a short time period reduces the window of opportunity for unauthorized personnel to take control of a management session enabled on the console or console port that has been left unattended. In addition, quickly terminating an idle session will also free up resources committed by the managed network element.

        Terminating network connections associated with communications sessions includes, for example, de-allocating associated TCP/IP address/port pairs at the operating system level and de-allocating networking assignments at the application level if multiple application sessions are using a single operating system-level network connection. This does not mean that the operating system terminates all sessions or network access; it only ends the inactive session and releases the resources associated with that session.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (TMOUT in /etc/profile.d/*.sh)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:512 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:TMOUT in /etc/profile.d/*.sh
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2401 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/profile.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.sh$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*declare[\s]+-xr[\s]+TMOUT[\s]*=[\s]*([\d]*)[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2400 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be less than or equal to '900'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204584 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement virtual address space randomization.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204584r880794_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040201
        Identities:SV-92521
        V-77825
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: Address space layout randomization (ASLR) makes it more difficult for an attacker to predict the location of attack code he or she has introduced into a process's address space during an attempt at exploitation. Additionally, ASLR also makes it more difficult for an attacker to know the location of existing code in order to repurpose it using return-oriented programming (ROP) techniques. false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system implement virtual address space randomization.

        Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a config file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

        kernel.randomize_va_space = 2

        Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

        # sysctl --system
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:92521
        Result:false
        Title:RHEL-07-040201 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement virtual address space randomization.
        Description:Address space layout randomization (ASLR) makes it more difficult for an attacker to predict the location of attack code he or she has introduced into a process's address space during an attempt at exploitation. Additionally, ASLR also makes it more difficult for an attacker to know the location of existing code in order to repurpose it using return-oriented programming (ROP) techniques.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (kernel.randomize_va_space is set to 2 in kernel)
          • false (kernel.randomize_va_space is set to 2 in the sysctl configuration files, and there are no conflicting settings in other files.)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9252100 (sysctl_test)
        Result:true
        Title:kernel.randomize_va_space is set to 2 in kernel
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9252100 (sysctl_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'kernel.randomize_va_space'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9252100 (sysctl_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '2'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ true ]
        • name equals 'kernel.randomize_va_space'
        • value equals '2'
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9252101 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:kernel.randomize_va_space is set to 2 in the sysctl configuration files, and there are no conflicting settings in other files.
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9252103 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • Collect any available items.
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9252101 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '2'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204585 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all networked systems have SSH installed.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204585r853989_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Pass
        Version:RHEL-07-040300
        Identities:SV-86857
        V-72233
        CCI-002418 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-8)
        CCI-002420 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-8 (2))
        CCI-002421 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-8 (1))
        CCI-002422 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-8 (2))
        Description: Without protection of the transmitted information, confidentiality and integrity may be compromised because unprotected communications can be intercepted and either read or altered.

        This requirement applies to both internal and external networks and all types of information system components from which information can be transmitted (e.g., servers, mobile devices, notebook computers, printers, copiers, scanners, and facsimile machines). Communication paths outside the physical protection of a controlled boundary are exposed to the possibility of interception and modification.

        Protecting the confidentiality and integrity of organizational information can be accomplished by physical means (e.g., employing physical distribution systems) or by logical means (e.g., employing cryptographic techniques). If physical means of protection are employed, logical means (cryptography) do not have to be employed, and vice versa.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000423-GPOS-00187, SRG-OS-000424-GPOS-00188, SRG-OS-000425-GPOS-00189, SRG-OS-000426-GPOS-00190 false
        Fix Text:Install SSH packages onto the host with the following commands:

        # yum install openssh-server.x86_64
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:

        V-204587 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all network connections associated with SSH traffic are terminated at the end of the session or after 10 minutes of inactivity, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204587r861072_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040320
        Identities:V-72237
        SV-86861
        CCI-001133 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-10; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-10.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-10; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-10)
        CCI-002361 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-12; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-12)
        Description: Terminating an idle SSH session within a short time period reduces the window of opportunity for unauthorized personnel to take control of a management session enabled on the console or console port that has been left unattended. In addition, quickly terminating an idle SSH session will also free up resources committed by the managed network element.

        Terminating network connections associated with communications sessions includes, for example, de-allocating associated TCP/IP address/port pairs at the operating system level and de-allocating networking assignments at the application level if multiple application sessions are using a single operating system-level network connection. This does not mean that the operating system terminates all sessions or network access; it only ends the inactive session and releases the resources associated with that session.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000163-GPOS-00072, SRG-OS-000279-GPOS-00109 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to automatically terminate a user session after inactivity time-outs have expired or at shutdown.

        Add the following line (or modify the line to have the required value) to the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor):

        ClientAliveInterval 600

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0

        V-204588 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not allow authentication using RSA rhosts authentication.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204588r603261_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Pass
        Version:RHEL-07-040330
        Identities:V-72239
        SV-86863
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: Configuring this setting for the SSH daemon provides additional assurance that remote logon via SSH will require a password, even in the event of misconfiguration elsewhere. false
        Fix Text:Configure the SSH daemon to not allow authentication using RSA rhosts authentication.

        Add the following line in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config", or uncomment the line and set the value to "no":

        RhostsRSAAuthentication no

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

        Result:true

        Description:SSH can allow authentication through the obsolete rsh command through the use of the authenticating user's SSH keys. This should be disabled.

          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)

        • version equals '7.4p1'
        • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
        • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
        • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204589 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all network connections associated with SSH traffic terminate after a period of inactivity.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204589r853992_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040340
        Identities:SV-86865
        V-72241
        CCI-001133 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-10; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-10.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-10; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-10)
        CCI-002361 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-12; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-12)
        Description: Terminating an idle SSH session within a short time period reduces the window of opportunity for unauthorized personnel to take control of a management session enabled on the console or console port that has been left unattended. In addition, quickly terminating an idle SSH session will also free up resources committed by the managed network element.

        Terminating network connections associated with communications sessions includes, for example, de-allocating associated TCP/IP address/port pairs at the operating system level and de-allocating networking assignments at the application level if multiple application sessions are using a single operating system-level network connection. This does not mean that the operating system terminates all sessions or network access; it only ends the inactive session and releases the resources associated with that session.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000163-GPOS-00072, SRG-OS-000279-GPOS-00109 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to terminate automatically a user session after inactivity time-outs have expired or at shutdown.

        Add the following line (or modify the line to have the required value) to the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor):

        ClientAliveCountMax 0

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1393
        Result:false
        Title:Set ClientAliveCountMax for User Logins
        Description:The SSH ClientAliveCountMax should be set to an appropriate value (and dependencies are met)
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (Tests the value of the ClientAliveCountMax setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1394 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:Tests the value of the ClientAliveCountMax setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3072 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)ClientAliveCountMax[\s]+([\d]+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:3073 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '0'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package openssh-server is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ not evaluated ]
        • name equals 'openssh-server'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'
        • release equals '21.el7'
        • version equals '7.4p1'
        • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
        • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
        • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204590 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not allow authentication using rhosts authentication.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204590r603261_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040350
        Identities:V-72243
        SV-86867
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: Configuring this setting for the SSH daemon provides additional assurance that remote logon via SSH will require a password, even in the event of misconfiguration elsewhere. false
        Fix Text:Configure the SSH daemon to not allow authentication using known hosts authentication.

        Add the following line in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config", or uncomment the line and set the value to "yes":

        IgnoreRhosts yes
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:

            • false (package openssh-server is removed)

        V-204591 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon an SSH logon.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204591r858477_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040360
        Identities:V-72245
        SV-86869
        CCI-000052 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-9)
        Description: Providing users with feedback on when account accesses via SSH last occurred facilitates user recognition and reporting of unauthorized account use. false
        Fix Text:Configure SSH to provide users with feedback on when account accesses last occurred by setting the required configuration options in "/etc/pam.d/sshd" or in the "sshd_config" file used by the system ("/etc/ssh/sshd_config" will be used in the example) (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor).

        Modify the "PrintLastLog" line in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" to match the following:

        PrintLastLog yes

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to "sshd_config" to take effect.

        V-204592 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not permit direct logons to the root account using remote access via SSH.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204592r603261_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040370
        Identities:V-72247
        SV-86871
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: Even though the communications channel may be encrypted, an additional layer of security is gained by extending the policy of not logging on directly as root. In addition, logging on with a user-specific account provides individual accountability of actions performed on the system. false
        Fix Text:Configure SSH to stop users from logging on remotely as the root user.

        Edit the appropriate "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file to uncomment or add the line for the "PermitRootLogin" keyword and set its value to "no" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor):

        PermitRootLogin no

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:

        Result:false

        Description:Root login via SSH should be disabled (and dependencies are met)
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (Tests the value of the PermitRootLogin[\s]*(<:nocomment:>*) setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:

        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)PermitRootLogin(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8687100 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'no'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false

        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.

        V-204593 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not allow authentication using known hosts authentication.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204593r603261_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040380
        Identities:V-72249
        SV-86873
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: Configuring this setting for the SSH daemon provides additional assurance that remote logon via SSH will require a password, even in the event of misconfiguration elsewhere. false
        Fix Text:Configure the SSH daemon to not allow authentication using known hosts authentication.

        Add the following line in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config", or uncomment the line and set the value to "yes":

        IgnoreUserKnownHosts yes

        V-204595 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon is configured to only use Message Authentication Codes (MACs) employing FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hash algorithms.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204595r877394_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040400
        Identities:SV-86877
        V-72253
        CCI-001453 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-17 (2))
        Description: DoD information systems are required to use FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hash functions. The only SSHv2 hash algorithm meeting this requirement is SHA.

        The system will attempt to use the first hash presented by the client that matches the server list. Listing the values "strongest to weakest" is a method to ensure the use of the strongest hash available to secure the SSH connection. false
        Fix Text:Edit the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file to uncomment or add the line for the "MACs" keyword and set its value to "hmac-sha2-512" and/or "hmac-sha2-256" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor):

        MACs hmac-sha2-512,hmac-sha2-256

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:168
        Result:false
        Title:RHEL-07-040400 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon is configured to only use Message Authentication Codes (MACs) employing FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hash algorithms
        Description:DoD information systems are required to use FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hash functions. The only SSHv2 hash algorithm meeting this requirement is SHA.

        By specifying a hash algorithm list with the order of hashes being in a "strongest to weakest" orientation, the system will automatically attempt to use the strongest hash for securing SSH connections.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (tests the value of MACs setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
            • false (MACs setting exists in /etc/ssh/sshd_config)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:170 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:tests the value of MACs setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2103 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)MACs[\s]+"?([\w,-@]+)+"?[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2104 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^hmac-sha2-512,hmac-sha2-256$'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:168 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:MACs setting exists in /etc/ssh/sshd_config
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3727 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • behavior requirements:
          • ignore_case = true
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*MACs[\s]+"?([\w,-@]+)+"?[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package openssh-server is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ not evaluated ]
        • name equals 'openssh-server'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'
        • release equals '21.el7'
        • version equals '7.4p1'
        • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
        • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
        • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204596 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH public host key files have mode 0644 or less permissive.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204596r603261_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Pass
        Version:RHEL-07-040410
        Identities:V-72255
        SV-86879
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: If a public host key file is modified by an unauthorized user, the SSH service may be compromised. false
        Fix Text:Note: SSH public key files may be found in other directories on the system depending on the installation.

        Change the mode of public host key files under "/etc/ssh" to "0644" with the following command:

        # chmod 0644 /etc/ssh/*.key.pub
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:120
        Result:true
        Title:SSHD Service Public Key Permissions
        Description:File permissions for the SSH Server's public keys should be set to 0644 (or stronger). By default, these files are located at /etc/ssh.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • true (Testing file permissions)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:121 (file_test)
        Result:true
        Title:Testing file permissions
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2070 (file_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • behavior requirements:
          • recurse_direction = down
        • path must be equal to '/etc/ssh/'
        • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.pub$'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2071 (file_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', suid must be equal to 'false'
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', sgid must be equal to 'false'
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', sticky must be equal to 'false'
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', uexec must be equal to 'false'
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', gwrite must be equal to 'false'
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', gexec must be equal to 'false'

        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', oexec must be equal to 'false'
        Collected Item/State Result:

        V-204597 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH private host key files have mode 0640 or less permissive.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204597r880743_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Pass
        Version:RHEL-07-040420
        Identities:V-72257
        SV-86881
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: If an unauthorized user obtains the private SSH host key file, the host could be impersonated. false
        Fix Text:Configure the mode of SSH private host key files under "/etc/ssh" to "0640" with the following command:

        # chmod 0640 /path/to/file/ssh_host*key
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:118
        Result:true
        Title:RHEL-07-040420 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH private host key files have mode 0640 or less permissive.
        Description:If an unauthorized user obtains the private SSH host key file, the host could be impersonated.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • true (Testing file permissions)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)

        V-204598 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not permit Generic Security Service Application Program Interface (GSSAPI) authentication unless needed.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204598r853993_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040430
        Identities:V-72259
        SV-86883
        CCI-000318 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-3 e; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-3.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-3 f; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-3 f)
        CCI-000368 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 c; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 c)
        CCI-001812 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-11 (2))
        CCI-001813 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-5 (1) (a))
        CCI-001814 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (1))
        Description: GSSAPI authentication is used to provide additional authentication mechanisms to applications. Allowing GSSAPI authentication through SSH exposes the system's GSSAPI to remote hosts, increasing the attack surface of the system. GSSAPI authentication must be disabled unless needed. false
        Fix Text:Uncomment the "GSSAPIAuthentication" keyword in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor) and set the value to "no":

        GSSAPIAuthentication no

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.

        If GSSAPI authentication is required, it must be documented, to include the location of the configuration file, with the ISSO.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:160
        Result:false
        Title:Disable GSSAPI Authentication
        Description:Unless needed, disable the GSSAPI authentication option for
        the SSH Server.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (tests the value of GSSAPIAuthentication setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:161 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:tests the value of GSSAPIAuthentication setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2099 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)GSSAPIAuthentication(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8688300 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'no'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ false ]
        • filepath equals '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • path equals '/etc/ssh'
        • filename equals 'sshd_config'
        • pattern equals '^[\s]*(?i)GSSAPIAuthentication(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance equals '1'
        • text equals 'GSSAPIAuthentication yes'
        • line equals 'GSSAPIAuthentication yes'
        • subexpression equals 'yes'
        Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
        subexpression
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package openssh-server is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ not evaluated ]
        • name equals 'openssh-server'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'
        • release equals '21.el7'
        • version equals '7.4p1'
        • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
        • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
        • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204599 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not permit Kerberos authentication unless needed.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204599r853994_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040440
        Identities:V-72261
        SV-86885
        CCI-000318 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-3 e; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-3.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-3 f; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-3 f)
        CCI-000368 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 c; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 c)
        CCI-001812 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-11 (2))
        CCI-001813 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-5 (1) (a))
        CCI-001814 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (1))
        Description: Kerberos authentication for SSH is often implemented using Generic Security Service Application Program Interface (GSSAPI). If Kerberos is enabled through SSH, the SSH daemon provides a means of access to the system's Kerberos implementation. Vulnerabilities in the system's Kerberos implementation may then be subject to exploitation. To reduce the attack surface of the system, the Kerberos authentication mechanism within SSH must be disabled for systems not using this capability. false
        Fix Text:Uncomment the "KerberosAuthentication" keyword in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor) and set the value to "no":

        KerberosAuthentication no

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.

        If Kerberos authentication is required, it must be documented, to include the location of the configuration file, with the ISSO.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:162
        Result:false
        Title:Disable Kerberos Authentication
        Description:Unless needed, disable the Kerberos authentication option for the SSH Server.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (tests the value of KerberosAuthentication setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:163 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:tests the value of KerberosAuthentication setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2100 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)KerberosAuthentication(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8688500 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'no'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package openssh-server is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ not evaluated ]
        • name equals 'openssh-server'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'
        • release equals '21.el7'
        • version equals '7.4p1'
        • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
        • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
        • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204600 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon performs strict mode checking of home directory configuration files.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204600r603261_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040450
        Identities:SV-86887
        V-72263
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: If other users have access to modify user-specific SSH configuration files, they may be able to log on to the system as another user. false
        Fix Text:Uncomment the "StrictModes" keyword in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor) and set the value to "yes":

        StrictModes yes

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0

        Publisher:DISA

        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

        Result:false

        Description:Enable StrictMode to check users home directory permissions and configurations.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (tests the value of StrictModes setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:

        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'

        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
