        V-204601 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon uses privilege separation.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204601r603261_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040460
        Identities:SV-86889
        V-72265
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: SSH daemon privilege separation causes the SSH process to drop root privileges when not needed, which would decrease the impact of software vulnerabilities in the unprivileged section. false
        Fix Text:Uncomment the "UsePrivilegeSeparation" keyword in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor) and set the value to "sandbox" or "yes":

        UsePrivilegeSeparation sandbox

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:171
        Result:false
        Title:Use Privilege Separation
        Description:Use privilege separation to cause the SSH process to drop root privileges when not needed.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (tests the value of UsePrivilegeSeparation setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:172 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:tests the value of UsePrivilegeSeparation setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2105 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)UsePrivilegeSeparation(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8688900 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'sandbox'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8688901 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'yes'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package openssh-server is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ not evaluated ]
        • name equals 'openssh-server'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'
        • release equals '21.el7'
        • version equals '7.4p1'
        • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
        • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
        • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204602 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not allow compression or only allows compression after successful authentication.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204602r880758_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Pass
        Version:RHEL-07-040470
        Identities:SV-86891
        V-72267
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: If compression is allowed in an SSH connection prior to authentication, vulnerabilities in the compression software could result in compromise of the system from an unauthenticated connection, potentially with root privileges. false
        Fix Text:Uncomment the "Compression" keyword in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor) on the system and set the value to "delayed" or "no":

        Compression no

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:158
        Result:true
        Title:Disable Compression Or Set Compression to delayed
        Description:SSH should either have compression disabled or set to delayed.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (tests the value of Compression setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
          • true (RHEL 7 version is 7.0, 7.1, 7.2 or 7.3) (negated)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:159 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:tests the value of Compression setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2098 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)Compression(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8689100 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^(no|delayed)$'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:15900 (textfilecontent54_test)

        V-204609 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not forward Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) source-routed packets.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204609r880797_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Pass
        Version:RHEL-07-040610
        Identities:V-72283
        SV-86907
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when IPv4 forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router. false
        Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

        net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0

        Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

        # sysctl -system
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:251
        Result:true
        Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
        Description:The "net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route set to the appropriate value)
          • true (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route setting in acceptable directory is set to 0, and nothing else, and there are no conflicting settings in other files)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:25100 (sysctl_test)
        Result:true
        Title:kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route set to the appropriate value
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2169 (sysctl_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:25100 (sysctl_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ true ]
        • name equals 'net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route'
        • value equals '0'
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:25101 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:true
        Title:net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route setting in acceptable directory is set to 0, and nothing else, and there are no conflicting settings in other files
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:25103 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • Collect any available items.
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:25101 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '0'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ true ]
        • filepath equals '/lib/sysctl.d/50-default.conf'
        • path equals '/lib/sysctl.d'
        • filename equals '50-default.conf'
        • pattern equals '(?:^|\.*\n)\s*net\.ipv4\.conf\.all\.accept_source_route\s*=\s*(\d+)\s*$'
        • instance equals '1'
        • text equals '
          net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0
          '
        • line equals '
          net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0
          '
        • subexpression equals '0'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ true ]
        • filepath equals '/usr/lib/sysctl.d/50-default.conf'
        • path equals '/usr/lib/sysctl.d'
        • filename equals '50-default.conf'
        • pattern equals '(?:^|\.*\n)\s*net\.ipv4\.conf\.all\.accept_source_route\s*=\s*(\d+)\s*$'
        • instance equals '1'
        • text equals '
          net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0
          '
        • line equals '
          net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0
          '
        • subexpression equals '0'

        V-204612 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not forward Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) source-routed packets by default.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204612r880806_rule

        Result:Pass
        Version:RHEL-07-040620

        Description: Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when IPv4 forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router. false

        V-204613 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not respond to Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) echoes sent to a broadcast address.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204613r880809_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040630
        Identities:V-72287
        SV-86911
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: Responding to broadcast (ICMP) echoes facilitates network mapping and provides a vector for amplification attacks. false
        Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

        net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts = 1

        Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

        # sysctl --system
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:284
        Result:false
        Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
        Description:The "net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts static configuration)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts set to the appropriate value)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:399 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts static configuration
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:20461300 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • Collect any available items.
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2280 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:332 (sysctl_test)
        Result:true
        Title:kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts set to the appropriate value
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

        V-204614 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages from being accepted.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204614r880812_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040640
        Identities:SV-86913
        V-72289
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages modify the host's route table and are unauthenticated. An illicit ICMP redirect message could result in a man-in-the-middle attack. false
        Fix Text:Set the system to not accept IPv4 ICMP redirect messages by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

        net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects = 0

        Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

        # sysctl --system
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:266
        Result:false
        Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages from being accepted.
        Description:ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages modify the host's route table and are unauthenticated. An illicit ICMP redirect message could result in a man-in-the-middle attack.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects setting in kernel is set to 0)
          • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects setting in a configuration file in an acceptable directory is set to 0, and nothing else, and no conflicting configurations are in the files)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:326 (sysctl_test)
        Result:false
        Title:net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects setting in kernel is set to 0
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2179 (sysctl_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2180 (sysctl_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ false ]
        • name equals 'net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects'
        • value equals '1'
        Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
        value
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:375 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects setting in a configuration file in an acceptable directory is set to 0, and nothing else, and no conflicting configurations are in the files
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2253 (textfilecontent54_object)

        V-204615 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must ignore Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204615r880815_rule

        V-204616 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow interfaces to perform Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects by default.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204616r880818_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040650
        Identities:V-72291
        SV-86915
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages contain information from the system's route table, possibly revealing portions of the network topology. false
        Fix Text:Configure the system to not allow interfaces to perform IPv4 ICMP redirects by default.

        Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

        net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects = 0

        Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

        # sysctl --system
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:281
        Result:false
        Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
        Description:The "net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects set to 0)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:395 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:20461600 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • Collect any available items.
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:20461600 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '0'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:331 (sysctl_test)
        Result:false
        Title:kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects set to 0
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2189 (sysctl_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2190 (sysctl_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ false ]
        • name equals 'net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects'
        • value equals '1'
        Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
        value

        V-204617 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not send Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204617r880821_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040660
        Identities:V-72293
        SV-86917
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages contain information from the system's route table, possibly revealing portions of the network topology. false
        Fix Text:Configure the system to not allow interfaces to perform IPv4 ICMP redirects.

        Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

        net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects = 0

        Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

        # sysctl --system
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:263
        Result:false
        Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not send Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects.
        Description:ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages contain information from the system's route table, possibly revealing portions of the network topology.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects set to 0)
          • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects setting in acceptable directory is set to 0, and nothing else, and there are no conflicting settings in other files)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:325 (sysctl_test)
        Result:false
        Title:kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects set to 0
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2177 (sysctl_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2178 (sysctl_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ false ]
        • name equals 'net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects'
        • value equals '1'
        Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
        value
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:371 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects setting in acceptable directory is set to 0, and nothing else, and there are no conflicting settings in other files
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

        V-204622 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that remote X connections are disabled except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204622r603849_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040710
        Identities:SV-86927
        V-72303
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: The security risk of using X11 forwarding is that the client's X11 display server may be exposed to attack when the SSH client requests forwarding. A system administrator may have a stance in which they want to protect clients that may expose themselves to attack by unwittingly requesting X11 forwarding, which can warrant a ''no'' setting.
        X11 forwarding should be enabled with caution. Users with the ability to bypass file permissions on the remote host (for the user's X11 authorization database) can access the local X11 display through the forwarded connection. An attacker may then be able to perform activities such as keystroke monitoring if the ForwardX11Trusted option is also enabled.
        If X11 services are not required for the system's intended function, they should be disabled or restricted as appropriate to the systems needs. false
        Fix Text:Edit the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file to uncomment or add the line for the "X11Forwarding" keyword and set its value to "no" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor):

        X11Forwarding no

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect:

        # systemctl restart sshd
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1389
        Result:false
        Title:RHEL-07-040710 - Disable X11 Forwarding
        Description:Open X displays allow an attacker to capture keystrokes and execute commands remotely.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (tests the value of X11Forwarding setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1390 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:tests the value of X11Forwarding setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3068 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • behavior requirements:
          • ignore_case = true
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*X11Forwarding[ \t]+([^\s#]*)[ \t]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:138900 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^(no|"no")$'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ false ]
        • filepath equals '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • path equals '/etc/ssh'
        • filename equals 'sshd_config'
        • pattern equals '^[\s]*X11Forwarding[ \t]+([^\s#]*)[ \t]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance equals '1'
        • text equals 'X11Forwarding yes'
        • line equals 'X11Forwarding yes'
        • subexpression equals 'yes'
        Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
        subexpression
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package openssh-server is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
        Collected Item/State Result:
        [ not evaluated ]
        • name equals 'openssh-server'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'
        • release equals '21.el7'
        • version equals '7.4p1'
        • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
        • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
        • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'

        V-204624 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have a graphical display manager installed unless approved.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204624r646847_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Pass
        Version:RHEL-07-040730
        Identities:SV-86931
        V-72307
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: Internet services that are not required for system or application processes must not be active to decrease the attack surface of the system. Graphical display managers have a long history of security vulnerabilities and must not be used unless approved and documented. false
        Fix Text:Document the requirement for a graphical user interface with the ISSO or reinstall the operating system without the graphical user interface. If reinstallation is not feasible, then continue with the following procedure:

        Open an SSH session and enter the following commands:

        $ sudo systemctl set-default multi-user.target

        $ sudo yum remove xorg-x11-server-Xorg xorg-x11-server-common xorg-x11-server-utils

        A reboot is required for the changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1305
        Result:true
        Title:Package xorg-x11-server-common Removed
        Description:The RPM package xorg-x11-server-common should be removed.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (package xorg-x11-server-common is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1306 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:true
        Title:package xorg-x11-server-common is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3014 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'xorg-x11-server-common'

        V-204625 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not be performing packet forwarding unless the system is a router.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204625r880824_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040740
        Identities:SV-86933
        V-72309
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: Routing protocol daemons are typically used on routers to exchange network topology information with other routers. If this software is used when not required, system network information may be unnecessarily transmitted across the network. false
        Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

        net.ipv4.ip_forward = 0

        Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

        # sysctl --system
        Severity:medium

        V-204630 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not forward IPv6 source-routed packets.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204630r880827_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Pass
        Version:RHEL-07-040830
        Identities:V-72319
        SV-86943
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when IPv6 forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router. false
        Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter, if IPv6 is enabled, by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

        net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0

        Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

        # sysctl --system
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:303
        Result:true
        Title:Kernel "net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
        Description:The "net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route set to the appropriate value)
          • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 static configuration)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 set to 1)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (ipv6.disable=1 in /proc/cmdline)
              • false (ipv6.disable=1 in grub.cfg)

        V-204631 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must have the required packages for multifactor authentication installed.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204631r853997_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-041001
        Identities:SV-87041
        V-72417
        CCI-001948 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (11))
        CCI-001953 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
        CCI-001954 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
        Description: Using an authentication device, such as a CAC or token that is separate from the information system, ensures that even if the information system is compromised, that compromise will not affect credentials stored on the authentication device.

        Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card.

        A privileged account is defined as an information system account with authorizations of a privileged user.

        Remote access is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless.

        This requirement only applies to components where this is specific to the function of the device or has the concept of an organizational user (e.g., VPN, proxy capability). This does not apply to authentication for the purpose of configuring the device itself (management).

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00160, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00161, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00162 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to implement multifactor authentication by installing the required packages.

        Install the pam_pkcs11 package with the following command:

        # yum install pam_pkcs11
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:87041
        Result:false
        Title:The operating system must have the required packages for multifactor authentication installed.
        Description:The operating system must have the required packages for multifactor authentication installed.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (package 'pam_pkcs11' is installed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8704101 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package 'pam_pkcs11' is installed
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8704101 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'pam_pkcs11'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204632 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement multifactor authentication for access to privileged accounts via pluggable authentication modules (PAM).

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204632r853998_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-041002
        Identities:V-72427
        SV-87051
        CCI-001948 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (11))
        CCI-001953 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
        CCI-001954 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
        Description: Using an authentication device, such as a CAC or token that is separate from the information system, ensures that even if the information system is compromised, that compromise will not affect credentials stored on the authentication device.

        Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card.

        A privileged account is defined as an information system account with authorizations of a privileged user.

        Remote access is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless.

        This requirement only applies to components where this is specific to the function of the device or has the concept of an organizational user (e.g., VPN, proxy capability). This does not apply to authentication for the purpose of configuring the device itself (management).

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00160, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00161, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00162 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to implement multifactor authentication for remote access to privileged accounts via pluggable authentication modules (PAM).

        Modify all of the services lines in "/etc/sssd/sssd.conf" or in configuration files found under "/etc/sssd/conf.d" to include pam.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA

        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

          • false (check if pam is configured in the services setting of a conf file in the sssd conf.d directory)

        Result:false
        Title:check if pam is configured in the services setting of the sssd section
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3081 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sssd/sssd.conf'

        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.

        Object Requirements:

        • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*\[sssd\]([^\n]*\n+)+?[\s]*services.*pam.*$'

        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-204633 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement certificate status checking for PKI authentication.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204633r853999_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-041003
        Identities:V-72433
        SV-87057
        CCI-001948 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (11))
        CCI-001953 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
        CCI-001954 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
        Description: Using an authentication device, such as a CAC or token that is separate from the information system, ensures that even if the information system is compromised, that compromise will not affect credentials stored on the authentication device.

        Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card.

        A privileged account is defined as an information system account with authorizations of a privileged user.

        Remote access is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless.

        This requirement only applies to components where this is specific to the function of the device or has the concept of an organizational user (e.g., VPN, proxy capability). This does not apply to authentication for the purpose of configuring the device itself (management).

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00160, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00161, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00162 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to do certificate status checking for PKI authentication.

        Modify all of the "cert_policy" lines in "/etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf" to include "ocsp_on".
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:87057
        Result:false
        Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement certificate status checking for PKI authentication.
        Description:Using an authentication device, such as a CAC or token that is separate from the information system, ensures that even if the information system is compromised, that compromise will not affect credentials stored on the authentication device.

        Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card.

        A privileged account is defined as an information system account with authorizations of a privileged user.

        Remote access is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless.

        This requirement only applies to components where this is specific to the function of the device or has the concept of an organizational user (e.g., VPN, proxy capability). This does not apply to authentication for the purpose of configuring the device itself (management).
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (Check all cert_policy entries are set with the ocsp_on option in /etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf)
          • false (Check cert_policy is set with the ocsp_on option 3 or more times in /etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf)

        Result:false
        Title:Check all cert_policy entries are set with the ocsp_on option in /etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8705700 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*cert_policy[ \t]+=[ \t]+([\w\,"' ]+);\s*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8705700 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^["']*ocsp_on["']*$|^["']*ocsp_on["',\s]|["',\s]ocsp_on["',\s]|["',\s]ocsp_on["']*$'

        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8705701 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:Check cert_policy is set with the ocsp_on option 3 or more times in /etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf

        Check:Result is based on check existence only.

        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*cert_policy[ \t]+=[ \t]+([\w\,"' ]*ocsp_on[\w\,"' ]*);\s*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '3'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        V-237633 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must restrict privilege elevation to authorized personnel.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-237633r646850_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Pass
        Version:RHEL-07-010341
        Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
        Description: The sudo command allows a user to execute programs with elevated (administrator) privileges. It prompts the user for their password and confirms your request to execute a command by checking a file, called sudoers. If the "sudoers" file is not configured correctly, any user defined on the system can initiate privileged actions on the target system. false
        Fix Text:Remove the following entries from the sudoers file:
        ALL ALL=(ALL) ALL
        ALL ALL=(ALL:ALL) ALL
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:177
        Result:true
        Title:RHEL-07-010341 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must restrict privilege elevation to authorized personnel.
        Description:The sudo command allows a user to execute programs with elevated (administrator) privileges. It prompts the user for their password and confirms your request to execute a command by checking a file, called sudoers. If the "sudoers" file is not configured correctly, any user defined on the system can initiate privileged actions on the target system.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (ALL does not exist /etc/sudoers)
          • true (ALL does not exist in /etc/sudoers.d)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:17700 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:true
        Title:ALL does not exist /etc/sudoers
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:17700 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sudoers'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*ALL\s+ALL\=\(ALL(?:|\:ALL)\)\s+ALL\s*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:17701 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:true
        Title:ALL does not exist in /etc/sudoers.d
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:17701 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/sudoers.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '^.*$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*ALL\s+ALL\=\(ALL(?:|\:ALL)\)\s+ALL\s*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'

        V-237634 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use the invoking user's password for privilege escalation when using "sudo".

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-237634r880755_rule
        Test Type:Automated
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-010342
        Identities:CCI-002227 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (5); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (5))
        Description: The sudoers security policy requires that users authenticate themselves before they can use sudo. When sudoers requires authentication, it validates the invoking user's credentials. If the rootpw, targetpw, or runaspw flags are defined and not disabled, by default the operating system will prompt the invoking user for the "root" user password.
        For more information on each of the listed configurations, reference the sudoers(5) manual page. false
        Fix Text:Define the following in the Defaults section of the /etc/sudoers file or a configuration file in the /etc/sudoers.d/ directory:
        Defaults !targetpw
        Defaults !rootpw
        Defaults !runaspw

        Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
        /etc/sudoers
        /etc/sudoers.d/
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
        Identifier:2899
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:178
        Result:false
        Title:RHEL-07-010342 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use the invoking user's password for privilege escalation when using "sudo".
        Description:The sudoers security policy requires that users authenticate themselves before they can use sudo. When sudoers requires authentication, it validates the invoking user's credentials. If the rootpw, targetpw, or runaspw flags are defined and not disabled, by default the operating system will prompt the invoking user for the "root" user password.
        For more information on each of the listed configurations, reference the sudoers(5) manual page.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (Defaults !targetpw is configured in /etc/sudoers)
            • false (Defaults !targetpw is configured in /etc/sudoers.d)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (Defaults !rootpw is configured in /etc/sudoers)
            • false (Defaults !rootpw is configured in /etc/sudoers.d)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (Defaults !runaspw is configured in /etc/sudoers)
            • false (Defaults !runaspw is configured in /etc/sudoers.d)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:17800 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:Defaults !targetpw is configured in /etc/sudoers
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:17800 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sudoers'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)Defaults\s+\!targetpw\s*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:17801 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:Defaults !targetpw is configured in /etc/sudoers.d
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:17801 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must match the pattern '^/etc/sudoers\.d.*'
        • filename must match the pattern '^.*$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)Defaults\s+\!targetpw\s*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:17802 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:Defaults !rootpw is configured in /etc/sudoers
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:17802 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sudoers'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)Defaults\s+\!rootpw\s*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:17803 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:Defaults !rootpw is configured in /etc/sudoers.d
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:17803 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must match the pattern '^/etc/sudoers\.d.*'
        • filename must match the pattern '^.*$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)Defaults\s+\!rootpw\s*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:17804 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:Defaults !runaspw is configured in /etc/sudoers
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:17804 (textfilecontent54_object)

        • instance must be equal to '1'
